reviews.text: One of my favorite places in NYC. It’s rare for people to rave about British food, but they know what they are doing. Don’t skip on their salad, it’s the type of thing you don’t want to order because the Scottish egg, the rarebit, the quail, the burger are all competing, but just add it. Great somm too. Cool vibe and decor. I can’t wait to go back.
reviews.author: Daniela Garza

reviews.text:
We were excited to dine at Lord’s after hearing great feedback on their burger.

Upon arrival we were promptly seated and greeted by our server. We ordered two drinks as we browsed the food menu. Sadly, we were informed they were out of the burger, although we dined at a pretty standard time for dinner on a Saturday night in NYC.

Instead, we ordered the oysters Kilpatrick, scotch egg, sirloin steak and frites and the duck pie.

Oysters Kilpatrick: While I liked this starter, my partner did not. He felt the flavors did not match well together.

Scotch Egg: For those who haven’t had this before, it’s lamb wrapped around an egg and deep fried. We enjoyed this dish, but there was nothing remarkable about it.

Sirloin Steak: Standard dish. The peppercorn sauce was good.

Duck Pie: The pastry itself was really great. The duck was flavorful, but given how rich duck is, we were unable to finish it.

Overall, we had a great experience. The ambiance was lovely, the service was impeccable, but we just didn’t love the food options. We hope if we visit again, we’ll be able to try their burger and turn this review around!
reviews.author: Manisha Marberry

reviews.text: Great good! Every dish surprised me in a pleasant way. It feels to me that every dish is a little playful and inventive take on traditionally English foods, and so far everything works surprisingly well!
reviews.author: Fred Lu

reviews.text:
Overall everything was solid! The desserts were great, entrees and specials were also delicious. I like the food here better than Dame (sister restaurant), but I wish their sticky toffee pudding was offered at lord’s!!

Will be back to try their burger!
reviews.author: Louie

reviews.text: We have a great dinner at Lord’s! Loved every dish we ordered, especially the quail toast and the Proper English Chips. The chips were super crispy on the outside and yet soft on the inside. Desserts should not be skipped! Service was also impeccable.

reviews.text: I have been ordering from this place for months. As Venezuelan, this place keeps a part of me still alive as culture and food are an important part of who I am. The food is as close as it can be as to being back home in Venezuela, the arepas, the Pabellón Criollo, I just can’t get enough of it. Today I decided to stop by on side and check out the vibe, and found myself with a cute, cozy atmosphere with GUACO playing. Felt right at home. Keep up the good work guys
reviews.author: Reagan G

reviews.text: Omg this was soo good! If you’re looking for good arepas this is the place. i loooove it im from Utah we have good arepas too but here in NY i highly recommend this place!

reviews.text: I don't usually do reviews but this cute little restaurant deserves it, please order the cachapa, arepa and tequeños, and you must try the green garlic sauce, they totally captured the essence of delicious Venezuelan food.

reviews.text: Great place, very friendly staff, excellent service and delicious food. This was my first time trying arepas and venezuelan cuisine in general,and i am amazed,10/10 recommend!

reviews.text: The ambiance was incredibly Latin and inviting from the moment I walked in. The staff's warm smiles made me feel right at home. Every dish was as delicious as a home-cooked meal."

reviews.text: One of the best places to get dinner in new york if you eat gluten free! The menu has so many options, it was hard to choose what to order! All the food was amazing, and the servers were amazing and let me practice my Italian with them. I recommend making a reservation if you’re coming on a weekend as it was quite busy, I was glad we reserved a table.

reviews.text: Brought my recently celiac diagnosed son for a special occasion. Pleasantly surprised by the quality of service and gluten free menu.  We were a party of 6 so had a chance to try multiple menu items, all of which were outstanding!  A little more expensive than I like but did not having to worry about what to order is priceless.  Highly recommend!
reviews.author: Tim Gerstmyer

reviews.text: I was there today. I didn’t think gluten-free food could be this good. But it was so delicious. I ordered Alla Bolognese and i love it.The ambience was very cute and made me feel comfortable. Finally, the employees were very attentive and friendly.
reviews.author: mira hacisalihoglu

reviews.text:
UPDATE:

We were contacted a while ago by the social media team about our experience at Senza and they offered to bring us back for a meal to redeem our past experience. I must confess, I am typically skeptical of experiences like this because some people have taken free meals just to say something nice and dishonest. But as a person who values integrity, I must confess this was not that case. Today at 3 PM, I and the same guest I visited with last time returned, and compared to last visit, our experiences were night and day when it came to the food. As previously shared, the atmosphere, service, and overall aesthetic of the restaurant were all phenomenal. This truly is a cozy establishment with genuine Italian influences that woo you. It is what draws you in initially and gives you high expectations and excitement for the meal you’re about to have. I have no idea the fluctuating factors that could’ve affected the meal the last time we were at Senza, but this time, the meal was delicious. Flavorful, fragrant, and delicious. Well seasoned, and cooked to perfection. I got the seafood spaghetti and my guest got the veal. Both dishes were something to rave about. Of course, the owner of the establishment tended to us well and shared her sincere heart of service and why she loves working where she does. And as a person with a great discernment for what’s hidden behind people’s words, I can tell you that she was being genuine. This isn’t just another restaurant that wants to make money, but there is a genuine vision and dream behind this restaurant. A desire that, by hard work and faith, other people will be blessed by what comes out of this place. Because they were willing to seek reconciliation and to clarify the confusion that happened, they have earned longtime customers from me and my guest. It wasn’t about giving us a delicious meal, but it was the open recognition of the review and a willingness to make it right. That is what made this experience phenomenal and the good food was an amazing plus. In the end, she even recommended that we come back and try the initial dishes we tried during the first visit. We definitely plan to with high hopes and restored excitement.

Thanks again.
Forgive me for taking a while to post this review as I’ve been delayed through recovery. I had high hopes for this Restaurant. When arriving. The atmosphere was amazing, and the service was impeccable. We were politely greeted and immediately sat. It looks like a cute mom and pop small Italian restaurant. The waiter even offered complementary gluten-free bread for me. But, the most disappointing factor of this experience was the meal itself. While upon presentation, it looked incredible, the taste was disappointing. Beyond the lack of seasoning, there was no garlic to be experienced. With every bite, I desperately searched for satisfaction with mouth fools of basil. To say the lease, I was disappointed. The pasta is not made in house, but seems to be ordered from an outside source. They provided a great portion for the chicken Parmesan, but even then it lacked flavor. The only remnants of pleasure were found in the burnt sprinkles of cheese on the bread of the chicken. I don’t even believe the chicken was marinated. I really had high hopes for this restaurant, considering myself, and my friend are both gluten-free. And it was a splurge. But spending between one $50-$200 for a plate of food that was not seasoned at all really was a low point of my day. And to top it all off, I had a severe stomach ache after. I’m not sure what type of gluten-free bread they used, but they might need to reconsider what recipes they are using, or what they’ve added. I hope this review helps someone consider this restaurant before their visit.

PS, our table was next to a middle-aged Italian, a couple. And upon receiving and tasting their food, the husband asked his wife in Italian, how she felt about her food, and she simply shrugged and closed her eyes. I think that says enough.
reviews.author: April Jones (AprilMayJune)

reviews.text: Literally everything was perfect! The service was probably the best we’ve ever experienced and the food was absolutely AMAZING! The feeling of being able to order anything on a menu with no gluten restrictions is nothing I’ve ever experienced. Would 1000000% recommend

reviews.author: Maeve J

reviews.text:
I was looking forward to trying Babbo. I would have thought of this as a classic. I would have been wrong. The decor was drab. The room felt dank. The music was good, but it had four or five songs by one artist at a time, first Elton John, then Queen, then maybe Springsteen, then it went out entirely.
The service was warm and efficient, but there were a lot of staff on the floor and I don't know who was in what role.
The food was just dated. The best dishes I tried were the octopus and a radicchio salad. The crab pasta listed serrano chilis but had no heat and the crab itself was bland and without flavor. The biggest disappointment was the pork chop with cherry tomatoes and cippollini. The pork was horribly overcooked (they didn't ask a temperature). It was covered in bell peppers and chopped onions, there was exactly one cippollini and half of a cherry pepper. We sent it back and it was removed from the bill.
The restaurant could only be described as tired. There's so many better options not far, try those.
reviews.author: Joshua Fyksen

reviews.text: Really enjoyed my dinner at Babbo. It’s one of the few places that serves Egg Raviolo. While the pasta was a bit al dente for my taste, I loved the creamy center and the butter sauce. The Pork Chop was excellent—juicy but with a nice char. And I liked the pickled onion that came with it. Service was friendly and attentive.

reviews.text: Upscale spot for Italian cuisine. Personal favorites were the braised beef ravioli, the red snapper crudo and the duck ragu special.

reviews.author: Bryce Yoo

reviews.text:
In Granpa Thai restaurant, one of the dishes we order was Thai Style Green Lemon Fish Slices Pot – a steamed Frankenfish, in a sauce made with lots of fresh lime juice, garlic, and chilies.
Also, a server explained that it is the most popular and marvelous steamed fish dish in Thailand. Its taste is sour, spicy, tart, fresh, garlicky, full of flavour, and well balanced in taste, I highly recommend because it really portrays the contrast and excitement of flavors in Thai food. I want to come again.
Also Thai iced milk green tea is so good. Not sweet and not strong. We like its sweet and refreshing taste, different from regular iced tea because it's more concentrated and flavorful.
reviews.author: Deto Imaginator

reviews.text: Wonderful addition to the neighborhood! Giant menu selection with dishes you don’t normally see at standard Thai restaurants. Fun drinks and desserts too! Food is delicious with generous portions, reasonable prices, spacious and airy atmosphere, and friendly service. Highly recommend! Hope they keep up the great work!
reviews.author: Michelle2Shop

reviews.text: Atmosphere is great, and the layout is very spacious and welcoming! The food was a perfect balance between being unique and authentic, and I would definitely come back. The seafood vermicelli salad was delicious and fresh tasting. The service was also amazing, they are very attentive here!
reviews.author: Jennifer Pham

reviews.text:
You know when people said “Try Artichoke Basille’s, it’s weird AF but you have to try it to believe it”, they were exactly right.
First off, the size of their slice is enormous, both in area as well as depth of the filling.
And the filling (on their artichoke slice) is weird, but creamy, cheesy, herby, and artichokey all around.
I’m not sure if it’s even pizza, but what it is is damn delicious and an all around great deal.
I got my slice thoroughly reheated and had a great meal.
reviews.author: Ruby

reviews.text:
I had one artichoke pizza for lunch and a crab pizza to-go for dinner. The crab one was a bit too salty and did not have the flavor I was hoping for, but the artichoke spice was surprisingly good. Tasted like a large quiche with a greater ratio of cheese to egg.

If you come at the wrong time, then the pizza sit in the store for a while, but the workers offer to give each slice a reheating in the oven (extra crispy). They also helped cut the slice in half so I could share with a friend.

I would recommend visiting this location if you are around the area. The price is pretty reasonable to try a type of pizza many other stores don't dare to make.
reviews.author: Veean Chen

reviews.text: Second time visiting Artichoke Basille's Pizza and must say their pizza is so unique and rich. One slice of the famous artichoke pizza was more than enough to fill the two of us. A few seats are available inside the restaurant.
reviews.author: Neha Vl

reviews.text:
Artichoke Pizza in Greenwich Village is a slice of heaven for pizza lovers! This small but mighty spot, developed by two brothers, serves up some of the most decadent pizza you’ll ever taste. The Artichoke Pizza on Broadway is especially famous for its super creamy, rich topping that feels just like artichoke dip, all atop a thick, hearty crust.

Since opening their first location in 2008, Artichoke Basille’s has expanded across the nation, gaining fame along the way. They’ve been featured on The Tonight Show, The Rachael Ray Show, and many other notable shows and publications. This place is the real deal.

We had a slice that was full of creamy goodness and double crusted – it was absolutely delicious and incredibly satisfying. If you find yourself in Greenwich Village, do yourself a favor and stop by Artichoke Pizza. It’s an experience your taste buds will thank you for!
reviews.author: Steve M.

reviews.text:
Best pizza in nyc.

This place has the most decadent pizza I've had in the best way possible. I've eaten a lot of pizza in both NY and Italy, and when the Artichoke slice is fresh, it's incomparable.

The slices are very big, one will get you full.

reviews.text:
Prefacing this with my being a homebody and non-drinker, so not exactly the target audience for a bar.
I stopped in since I had a free drink from donating blood, and decided to order some wings to go along with it. The wings were super crisp despite the barbecue sauce and were a very pleasant surprise (justifies the pricing a bit but still more than I'd like). The "cherish me" drink was pretty good but also small, so value was hit or miss depending on your wallet.
The bartender was nice and responsive,  no complaints there. It was hard to sit down though, since there wasn't much open seating, but that would depend on the day.
Overall, I'd consider going back.
reviews.author: Warkah Scott

reviews.text:
The New York Blood Center has this place as one of their participating venues. After my project at Union Square, I decided to go here despite the rainy day that ensued. I had three vouchers from the center and let's just say that I made a good decision. Their food smelled awesome so I had a chicken little along with my entitled free drinks. I left the choices up to the bar since I'm not very picky.

Anyway, I had a fun time here and the staff were super chill. There was an event planned here so I was lucky to witness it. Don't know what it was but it looked like the customers were having a swell time. Even though it's my first visit, I have more than enough Intel to conclude that this place deserves your time and your business. I would recommend and I say give it a chance to impress you.
reviews.author: Virgilio Samo III

reviews.text: I got a table for me and my partner on Halloween after aimlessly walking miles to finally find somewhere with food AND a useable bathroom.  But we sat and wanted to order sodas and food, note* no alcohol because our night was already crappy. We were just starving. Our server who was wearing cat leopard costume needed a card to open a bar tab but we only had cash, being im a waitress i understand, I offered my ID in replacement if possible but she refused that so we agreed to put all of our stuff in and close out immediately to make her life easier, because again, I am also a waitress. We closed out and got our change, the food immediately came, we’re eating and talking and as I have a mouth full of food this waitress approaches me and my boyfriend on some “so no tip?” …I’m sorry but when ever have you gotten a tip before we’re done eating? And who approaches their customers like that while they’re eating and talking. I genuinely would never go out to eat anywhere and not tip, I tip fast food workers. Food industry is hard, especially in the city. I also normally don’t write reviews but I was officially appalled when I looked over to see her with her co workers pointing at my check she just grabbed and telling her I didn’t tip. At least walk farther away to speak badly on a customer. I approached her nicer than I should’ve been explaining I had a bad night, I was trying to get more than 4 bites into my food but not tipping her was never on my agenda. After I approached her she fully fixed her attitude and tried apologizing, I appreciated the correction in behavior but honestly I didn’t finish any of my food and immediately felt uncomfortable.  The male hostess and manager were very kind and the atmosphere was very nice, my only issue was that server
reviews.author: nope nope

reviews.text: A fun bar near NYU. I visited this bar last week with a friend and we both enjoyed ourselves. We had the bottomless mimosas (very good) while we waited for an event. Our bartenders were very friendly, and the atmosphere was lively as well. This seems like a great place to watch games as many sports shows we’re on while we were there. They have some good food options as well. Definitely a good time.
reviews.author: Syerra Carigo

reviews.text: Booked a semi-private space with them for our wedding rehearsal dinner and they had an awesome event offering, and their event team was one of the best I’ve worked with in the city! They were so attentive, and even reached out week of as there was a big game scheduled to be streamed there the same time as our event so they moved us downstairs to our own section so that our rehearsal dinner wouldn’t become too loud or mixed with the regular crowd coming to enjoy the bar. Would definitely book with them again for an event, as well as would go watch games there! Definitely recommend.

Finally reunited with my favorite bowl! So glad this branch remained open after the one on 2nd Avenue closed abruptly.

It’s a nice small cozy restaurant, the food quality is great, prices are affordable and the staff are pleasant.

reviews.text: So this a takeaway/restaurant (only 8 seats, four tables total) and doesn't have a bathroom. But the food was quick and great tasting. We were very impressed with the mixture of carbs, protein and vegetables in the different bowls. We had prawns (shrimp) in one and again impressed with the amount of prawns we received. You are looking at about $12 for a good size main. See photos for details on prices for their menu
reviews.author: Hugh Price

reviews.text: Small place on McDougle street. We came across it since we were already there, and decided to go for it. We had the make your own bowl with the gonjugang sauce, and we loved it. The serving size is huge, we still have the leftovers. Heads up, they charge more than 1$ for extra meat (we didn’t pay much attention to it hence we missed it). All in all, a really cute place with quick service and good food 👍🏻
reviews.author: Hira Rizvi

reviews.text: Decided to go here on Wednesday, December 8. Created my bowl and paid about $17 for it. Mixed everything up in my bowl, however, while eating, I found the pork belly to be very dry plus not enough sauce was put in. I ended up finishing 75% of it as I was hungry. My friend created his own bowl as well and he told me that the chicken was dry as well. I do not know all the protein options are like this, but sad to say that, I won’t be back. I thought this spot had potential as it was a 4.0 on Yelp & 4.3 on Google, but I was wrong.
reviews.author: ADRIAN Y. (AD)

reviews.text: My coworkers rave about this hole in the wall. The restaurant is fast causal and does have seating available. I ordered the chicken Bangkok. I thought it was going to be chicken breast but, it was chicken thigh. Personally, I am not a fan of chicken thigh. They did give a good portion of meat, grain, and veggie. The bowl reminded me of a deconstructed banh-mi. I do wish that they gave more sauce with the meat. I had ordered my bowl before coming but it wasn't prepared even though they weren't super busy. It did take the guy a few minutes to get it ready so, I didn't have to wait too long.

The dish I had missed the mark a bit. Though others on the menu look good and may be preferable to my pallet. 

I'll never know. The real problem with the...

reviews.text:
We were blown away by the service and quality of the food on the Omakase menu!

At only $75 we were beautifully presented with all kinds of seafood, caviar, uni, tuna belly and more.

Our dishes were created right in front of us by chef Steve, who was really friendly and happy to chat to us about his craft, even if English wasn’t his strongest language. We learnt so much whilst eating the most incredible food.

They also had a series of reasonably priced extras which you could add on the end, such as crab or a repeat of your favourite piece.
reviews.author: Matt Owens

reviews.text:
I had my birthday celebration at this amazing place. Chef Steve consistently delivered exceptional food, clearly explanation, and service, even going as far as preparing a birthday cake 🎂 to surprise me! I was truly touched by the effort and quality of service provided by the staff.

The quality of the food was excellent. In particular, I had high expectations for the UNI, and it didn’t disappoint at all.
reviews.author: Namkwann Mu

reviews.text:
I recently celebrated my wife's birthday at Kazumi Sushi in the West Village, and it was an absolutely incredible experience. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with warmth and hospitality. The staff went above and beyond to make us feel special, and their attentiveness made the evening truly memorable.

The food at Kazumi Sushi was nothing short of exceptional. Each dish was a masterpiece, bursting with fresh flavors and beautifully presented. The sushi was some of the best we’ve ever had, and the variety on the menu ensured there was something for everyone to enjoy.

What really set the evening apart was the generosity of the staff. Throughout the night, we were treated to complimentary sake, beer, and even a delicious cake to celebrate my wife’s birthday. These thoughtful touches added an extra layer of joy to our celebration.

The combination of outstanding food, friendly service, and a festive atmosphere made for a fantastic evening. Kazumi Sushi is now at the top of our list for special occasions. We’ll definitely be back!
reviews.author: Kyle Stim

reviews.text: Went here last night for my friend's birthday dinner, we're party of 14 and got the last reservation from 9-10pm. we really had a good time food is excellent, Chef Henry, Chef Steve and chef Jay are awesome!!! best experience for Omakase with friends.
reviews.author: E N

reviews.text: I had the most amazing experience at this newly opened omakase restaurant! From the moment I walked in, the staff went above and beyond to accommodate my allergies, amd the chef made sure every single dish was not only safe but absolutely delicious. The service was beyond exceptional, attentive, and genuinely caring. I can't recommend this place enough! Whether you have allergies or just want an unforgettable dining experience, you have to try it!

reviews.text: I had high expectations and dined here today. Since it’s Restaurant Week, we were able to enjoy a course meal for $45 per person. We spent around $150 in total, including tips, but not a single dish was satisfying. We came based on recommendations, but we won’t be coming back.

reviews.text: Crispy sushi sounds good but in practice meant that the sushi could fall apart since the crpisies left a dry layer between the rice and fish. Sushi overall was OK. Service is also VERY slow. They need more staff — we had to flag a waiter down to get our bill.
reviews.author: Marvin Bernal

reviews.text: Visited for lunch and really enjoyed the Yosenabe Set; the Truffle Dashimaki add-on was incredibly creamy and rich in truffle flavor. Overall, it was a comforting meal with friendly and efficient service.
reviews.author: Bill Wang

reviews.text:
Probably not the best version of everything but definitely still solid flavors wise. Expensive prices for small quantity of food but there aren’t many authentic Japanese restaurants in the city so I still appreciate this spot for what it is

Super friendly staff. I was waiting outside for them to reopen from their afternoon break and was the first one to enter when they did so I had all the wait staff lined up and greeting me together😭. They greet all guests in Japanese upon entry

Really pretty light fixtures/interior and soft music. Clean space

First time I’ve seen natto sold at a restaurant. So happy to try for the first time mixed w rice as I’ve always seen it in Shin Chan! Katsu is extremely crispy and juicy. Truly delicious w their ponzu radish sauce. Beef potato croquettes crispy and taste nicely of mashed potatoes. Onsen eggs were amazing

Recommended dishes: katsu, onsen eggs, potato beef croquettes
reviews.author: Jammy Jams

reviews.text:
AVOID AT ALL COST!

Possibly the worst meal I’ve ever had in NYC. Pictures on the menu looked amazing and are proper Japanese dishes but the grilled miso cod was possibly just steamed (probably not properly defrosted), the sukiyaki was just overly sweet. None of the appetizers (chawanmushi, agedeshi tofu) were even on par.

Service wise, I had to decork the bottle of Umeshu I ordered and a napkin on the ground next to us was never picked up the whole time we were there. AC was not barely working, and they made us rush to get a table when there were plenty of seats.

Total amounted to 300 for 4 people. Not sure how this place survives in NYC..

Yummmm

This is my favorite spot to get Japanese food in NYC.

This establishment has been here since Covid - there's a lot of seating especially during...

Food (3.5/5)
- Food was decent
- I got the tonkatsu as a teishoku set which was a lot of food but with smaller portions
- Thought it was pretty good/decent....
reviews.author: Beryce G.

reviews.text:
Overall, this place is so fun. If you're a Jimmy Buffett fan, you'll love it here- basically a Tiki bar.
The drinks are fun and zany, and the brunch pitcher deal is also a steal. The food is pretty yummy, not too fancy, but if you're going for a brunch, I would recommend getting multiple plates as the portions are on the smaller side.
The first time I went, service wasn't great. The wrong dishes were sent out, and it felt like our server forgot us several times.
However, the second time Pan was wonderful and we really appreciated how kind she was!

And on a side note, this place is really great for sports (obviously... It's a Tampa Bay and F1 bar).
reviews.author: Lily Clark

reviews.text:
We saw a sign for their alcoholic desserts and went in. They looked so good. We ordered the sundae's sans the rum. They were delicious.

The staff is very friendly and accommodating. They did change our seating; we sat ourselves in the wrong area. I apologized and mentioned that I only chose this seat because it had my favorite number on it. Without me asking, they moved the number with us. It was such a simple and kind gesture, yet it really did make my day.

Our server was very nice and really insightful when helping us choose our orders.

We found out that they are open for breakfast. We'll be back for their waffles :D
reviews.author: Kimberlyn Alava

reviews.text:
I went here for the first time and we were very hungry so came here as one of my friend has been here, so was super excited to be here.
Came here and the server who was serving us his shift ended and we closed the check, no one did last call on our table neither there was anyone serving us.

Turns out i forgot to order lava cake so i asked Other server who was serving right next table, i asked him if i can order lava cake, he replied rudely, that the last call is written on the menu that it is 11:45. Sorry I didn’t see the last call for kitchen. I didn’t come to this place to read books, if they closed the kitchen SERVER LUIS could have simply said sorry the kitchen is closed instead he choose to say that “i know you are a little drunk but you should have read the menu and i am not your server still i am serving you”, for me it takes a threshold to put a bad review.

But he really needs to learn how to serve or at least be polite, he is in no position to judge me, where i only had one glass of wine and wasn’t even drunk. Like this is very disappointing. Plus i am person who give 20% tip every where i go. Even here i gave 20% tip, but this was not acceptable.
reviews.author: Heli Mistry

reviews.text:
1st time here and I thought the place was amazing they had a live band which was really really good…the ambiance, decor and staff was great! The drinks were good and strong I had the fish bowl and my gf had a martini which I thought was stronger than my fish bowl but overall it was good. We didn’t try the food so can’t say anything about it but we’ll definitely be back for it.

If you’re ever in the city this place is a must try!
reviews.author: Naj H.

reviews.text: We had a lot of fun at Wicked Willy’s.  We came here on a Wednesday night after being recommended it from over a year and a half ago.  The security harassed a woman waiting for her friend outside alone as he was checking out ID’s which delayed our entry.  It was wine Wednesday so only $6 for a glass which was great!  We watched the security guard harass another woman who was waiting for her boyfriend sitting alone.  This was icky.  Our waitress greeted us with a smile but not much more- still friendly throughout!  We ordered the loaded nachos with chicken, steak quesadillas, and spicy chicken wrap.  The food was delicious!  We happened to go on karaoke night which was a shock to us but we rolled with it.  The host hyped everyone up and made people feel comfortable to sing by starting us off.  She gave every singer candy at the end and it seemed like everyone had such a great time.  We even went up to sing and when no one clapped she made us feel seen despite that!  The atmosphere is so cool- sea / mermaid / captain theme.  They also had an outdoor area in the back and seemed to have games but we didn’t go back there since it’s the middle of February.  I’d love to come here again!

reviews.text: I'm not one to review places, but I had such a good experience I wanted to share my appreciation. They gave me 2 free al pastor tacos! Not only were they free, they were absolutely delicious! I was a little skeptical since they were just giving them away, but they were every bit as flavorful as I expect from a real good Mexican spot. And there was free horchata to boot! No idea why they were offering so much for free, but I'm certainly not complaining, especially around the NYU area. The only thing I paid for was my (very tasty) chips and guac, making my whole lunch a whopping $5.  Definitely will return! Even if I have to pay next time 😂

reviews.text:
We came here because we live nearby and were too lazy to go far given we were up from 4am for the Macy's Parade. Therefore, no real expectations.

But White Oak is fantastic! Surprised people don't talk about it more. The food is great and not that expensive relative for these sorts of things in Manhattan. The Mac n Cheese was 🔥 and the Thanksgiving Turkey special was spectacular. French onion soup was solid but probably the least exciting dish.

Service was good, cocktails sharp and the drinks selection broad.

Decor within the venue was beautiful as well. Will have to turn this into my local go to!

Just right for groups with uncertain numbers.

reviews.text:
The place was very cute and cozy.  For me just a little too dim, but that's just because I like everything to be bright.  Customer service was on point, we never had to request for our refills.  Very attentive and all our food came out as we requested.  The food itself was delicious,  def one of the best French Toasts Ive had and I am not a French Toast girlie.  I also really loved the flavor of the steak and eggs.  That came with a salad and fries.  Salad had the perfect amount of dressing and the fries just had the right type of crunch!

I didn't give 5 Stars because I believe that the portion to price didn't match.  I was still pretty hungry and it left me wanting more.

It was busy,  but it didn't feel cramped. We were very comfortable.

I would def recommend this place because everything we had was delicious.   I'm looking forward to trying the food that wasn't a part of their brunch menu next time .... it all looked so good.
reviews.author: AC D

reviews.text:
This is a spot you go to to get drunk with your friends. A very college friendly restaurant for bottomless brunch. The food itself is alright. And the bottomless mimosas are actually not very good, but you’re here for a good time, not a life changing delicious time.

This is a fun place. Full of young people and loud music. We ordered the eggs purgatory (very cheesy. mostly ricotta.) and the eggs benedict (on biscuit with prosciutto) The food wasn’t bad but also not amazing. An entree comes with the bottomless brunch but we opted not to get wasted. Had one mimosa each which was mid to be honest, but it is expected of the area. Next time we will try the pizza.
reviews.author: gale v

reviews.text:
As with many restaurants I’ve visited in NYC, I ate here with my family; we chose this place after hearing a local band would be playing tonight.
Having lived in Austin, the live music capital of the world, any place with live performances from local artists gets a rating boost in my eyes. Perhaps a rock band isn’t exactly the vibe for an Italian restaurant like this but I liked it regardless.
The service was phenomenal. A loud musical performance might make ordering difficult but the staff were attentive, took our orders well, and made sure we always had water.
Food-wise, you can’t go wrong with a pizza and a couple appetizers. My girlfriend and I shared the tartufa pizza, Brussel sprouts, and fries. The Brussel sprouts were by far the stars of the night (off-stage of course). They were slightly crispy with a salty-savoriness from the diced pancetta. The fries were pretty standard truffle fries, good stuff but if I were to get the two appetizers again I’d just choose Brussel sprouts twice. The tartufa pizza was top notch with mushrooms and a bit of truffle flavor. The only drawback was the slight sogginess of the bread; a slightly crispier bread would’ve made the pizza topper notch.
If I visit again in the future, I’ll likely order the brussel sprouts again and perhaps some other pizza and ask if they can possibly make it a bit crunchier/toastier. Regardless, excellent food overall.
reviews.author: Carlos Repetto-Ayala

reviews.text: Great brunch spot. Our server was incredible. The food was excellent. Their eggs benedict were sooooo delicious. All of their pizzas are a hit. I’ve tried most of them and it is a no-brainer. This place is definitely a safe choice for a good bottomless brunch on the weekends!
reviews.author: Dilan A

reviews.text: Made a reservation for brunch as we were planning to see a show in Union Square afterwards. The weather was lovely so we decided to sit outside which was a great choice. Gigi was our server and she was literal perfection. Attentive, answered all our questions and continually made sure we were taken care of as we dined. She even offered to take our photo as she could tell we were having a great time, very much appreciate that in a server. I had the Pappardelle which was delicious, fresh noddles, braised pork, would highly recommend. Can’t wait to come back and try more!

reviews.text:
Overall, not a bad place but overpriced for what you get. I do not recommend coming here. There's much better Caribbean food elsewhere, especially uptown.

The jerk chicken was nice and spicy but a little dry inside. For most of the food here, it's a bit overpowering on the spice (rather than a careful cooking for the texture) so you're not a spicy food person? You may not like the menu.

The server was friendly and knowledgeable. The hostess had a lot of attitude. I arrived at 2:00 p.m. and the place was completely empty, but she acted like the place was fully booked. We had a reservation confirmed.

Finally, there was something weird going on with the music. It would stop every now and then and the volume would fluctuate two notches up and down throughout the song. Kind of strange. The music gave it a nice upbeat vibe but also rendered a place. Not as great for intimate conversations.

reviews.text: I love this place ! The food was 10/10 the oxtail soup is definitely worth the try. My servers name was Andre ( I think ) but he was great attentive to everything even let me meet the chefs to give them their flowers. As a born and raised Jamaican give this place a try ! It’s BYOB , but trust me the mock tails they make are amazing you add your own liquor and there is your cocktail !

reviews.text: This place was amazing ! Anthony our waiter absolutely phenomenal. My husband took me here for my birthday in may and we came back a month later to celebrate our 8 year anniversary. The food was amazing. You can bring your own bottle and Anthony has the perfect recommendations for what to mix with.
reviews.author: Leeyahh

reviews.text:
Our party of two went to Negril this past Mother’s Day, and although we didn’t have a reservation we were warmly welcomed and quickly seated. Our server Christina came over and introduced herself. I don’t think I’ve ever had such a warm and personable server as Christina. What a beautiful spirit she has. By the time we left it felt like we had known her for years. She truly enhanced our dining experience at Negril.

And the food? Spot on! We had plantain as appetizers, which were perfectly made. One entree we had was lobster tails with a side of grits. Another was chicken roti. Both were delicious with just the right amounts of seasonings. We also had some crazy delicious drinks. One was passion fruit and another I don’t recall exactly, except for the fact it was tasty and refreshing (that’ll be the white colored one in the pics).

I love the vibe of this place. The music is at the perfect level, (not too loud), and the interior design is pleasing to the eyes. Way back when I used to frequent the old place on 23rd when I lived in Chelsea, but I like the atmosphere at W. 3rd even more.

The only reason I’m not rating Negril higher is because it took an unreasonably long time for our food to come out. We were told that our order had not printed out in the kitchen (or something to that effect). Because of the delay we were unable to make the next event of our evening and had to cancel and reschedule, which was disappointing. While the delay altered our evening plans, after we canceled the next event we were then able to relax more and enjoy the great dishes and environment. Gotta be flexible and roll with it sometimes.

In spite of the above, I’m looking forward to returning (largely because of the amazing service Christina provided), and have already been thinking about what to get next time! In closing I admired the professional, yet warm and personable staff, loved the great food, and just simply enjoyed being there. Give Negril a try, I’m sure you’ll love it.
Highly recommended!
reviews.author: Michael Panton

reviews.text:
So where do I begin? We had a 5 o’clock reservation for my husbands 50th birthday. The restaurant opens at 5 but allowed us in ten minutes early because it was HOT outside. We were seated exactly at 5. We had our drinks with in 15 minutes as well as our orders placed.
The ackee & salt fish tostones & jerk shrimp are THEE best option on the menu although all are good. We ordered mango daiquiris which were really good. Our main dish was the Curry Lobster, shrimp & salmon roti. I’ve never had food so tasty. We added sides of rice & peas along with mac N cheese which was really good. For dessert we had the passion fruit cheesecake & the black rum cake. Fellas let me warn you, the rum cake will make you stand up! The food was great & the portions were worth the money. We ended up taking food home! Also our hostess/ server Linden was very inviting & provided great service! Thumbs up Negril village!!!

reviews.text:
Some of the best Omakase I’ve had. The ingredients were so delicious and you could tell they were fresh. After each bite, my friends and I would look at each other silently while chewing, just in awe over the flavors. I believe the set came with 2 appetizers, 16 courses, and a dessert, which was all-in-all very worth it and filling.

It’s an intimate space that might be reservation-only, and the mood was traditional-feeling and vibrant. The staff and sushi chefs were very accommodating and great to interact with. If you let them know you don’t like wasabi or need reasonable modifications, they are very good with that. We got some Sake which were great. I would recommend asking for their recommendations. We tried a sweeter one and it went down very nicely. I also recommend offering some to the staff and sushi chefs if the vibes are right!

I’ve attached just some photos of my favorites of the night, but I can say for certain that each one was delicious. We will be back!
reviews.author: Erin Yang

reviews.text:
Experience at Sakai Omakase was beyond my expectations. I booked the reservation ahead to make sure I got seats for my anniversary. I got there on time and lucky enough to find a street parking space as you know finding a parking in Soho is not that easy. The restaurant is on basement and no sign outside, it looks like many omakase place like to do nowadays.

Service was great and always pay attention to what customers need. Excellent quality of food for the price I pay. I'm glad I picked this place to celebrate the special day. Recommended.
reviews.author: Melissa Naja

reviews.text: Sekai Omakase offers an unforgettable dining experience! The chef’s selection was fresh, beautifully presented, and each course felt like a work of art. If you’re looking for high-quality sushi in an intimate setting, this place is a must-try in New York!
reviews.author: Sohee Kim

reviews.text: This is one of my favorite spot in the city! Chef Eddy provides his customers great experience and food for those who crave edomae sushi. If you want traditional Japanese sushi at a great price Sekai is the answer. His 16 course is good enough but his supplement list is the real deal where you can find options that are hard to find in other omakase places in the city.
reviews.author: Jaewoo Koh

reviews.text:
Food: Overall fresh, with freshly grated wasabi, which was a nice touch. However, I found the seasoning inconsistent—some fish lacked flavor, and the truffle on ikura was overpowering, a confusing combo.

Ambience: Very disappointing. The atmosphere was ruined by loud patrons, and the staff did nothing to manage the noise. For a $100+ per person experience, I expect a calm, quiet environment to enjoy the sushi and interact with the chef. We couldn't wait to leave.

Service: Service was okay, but the constant display of fish photos on an iPad felt unnecessary and confusing.

While the food was decent, the lack of ambiance control makes it unlikely I'll return, especially with the risk of another noisy experience.
reviews.author: Sung Hwang

reviews.text: I was treated to Sekai for my birthday this year and couldn't have had a better time! The setting leans no-frills, with a sparse, spartan, spare dining...
reviews.author: Andrew W.

reviews.text: I was skeptical given the recent proliferation of omakase spots of varying quality, but this one is a winner. The ambiance is perfect for people seeking a...
reviews.author: Katherine F.

reviews.text: My family of four enjoyed Sunday brunch at Loring Place. Overall, we had a pleasant experience. The food was delicious and prepared well. The pancakes were great, and the scrambled eggs were fantastic. The staff was attentive, and the restaurant decor was comfortable and nicely appointed. There were a few minor annoyances that I took issue with. The hot tea, orange pekoe, was not good at all, and the restaurant did not have any sugar substitutes, such as stevia. Lastly,  we were charged an additional fee for "still" water, which was tap water. This was a new one for us.
reviews.author: William Welch

reviews.text: This was just an all round great restaurant! Nice modern and spacious design, friendly and attentive service, and a wonderful menu focused on seasonal ingredients. I started with a grilled strawberry and cherry tomato salad, seemingly simple but bursting with flavor. For the main, I had a sea bass with summer beans in a peach tomato sauce that was outstanding - perfectly cooked, a sprinkle of nuts on top providing a nice texture contrast, and all the great summer flavors really shining. The one letdown of the evening was dessert - the vanilla sundae didn’t really do it for me and looked premade. I won’t judge too harshly though - on a return visit I’d probably just go with one more of their appetizers, many of which sounded really good.
reviews.author: ReedH

reviews.text:
So happy with this restaurant!
The dishes were plated in such delicate and detailed way, perfect for get you ready to get into all the flavors. The Grandma-style pizza is a must! And arrive just in time!
Also it’s such a great place with an amazing staff and the perfect ambiance; the brunch bartender suggested the best cocktails keeping in mind my preferences about liquor.
Definetly Loring Place continue show dishes full of flavor, color and an open invitation to come back for more.
reviews.author: Nathalia Zapata

reviews.text:
Had a great time here. Chill atmosphere, delicious granny style pizza, solid if limited beer selection.

Staff were super friendly, as well as the other customers. Prices are not high, and reasonable. Would return.
reviews.author: Nx Mx

reviews.text: We have nothing but amazing feedback on our private room booking! The food was great, and everything was organized and timely. This was a special family reunion, and we really appreciated the warm, friendly atmosphere. Big thanks to Taylor, our server, for being so patient with the kids and language barrier, and to Eliza for coordinating everything seamlessly. Highly recommend for any group gathering or just a great meal!

Update"

reviews.text: Went here the night of June 21 for the first and last time. The bouncer was inside slurring his words and clearly drunk while walking around aimlessly trying to start a fight with the bar's six or seven patrons. When I brought this up to the bartender, he sighed and shook his head in exasperation as if this were a regular occurrence but did not take any action. We did not feel safe and left shortly after. Save your money and go to one of the many other bars in the area instead!

reviews.text: glad we stumbled across this restaurant. we had a nice late lunch. christina, our server was the absolute best! she accommodated us really nicely and made sure everything came out perfect. the apple spritz was nice and refreshing and my steak frites was amazing! really good, cooked just the way i like it. the prices are reasonable and the serving is great. great service! highly recommend! we’re definitely coming back.

reviews.text: Great breakfast spot! I ordered the salmon tartine and added an egg. It was very fresh and tasty. The coffee was also good. Friendly service and clean spot. The background music was also perfect for ambiance. No coffee refills but do recommend!

reviews.text: Had a good experience here! It was a hot day in New York, and we were looking for a cool, cozy spot for brunch. The place was busy but welcoming. The staff were friendly and attentive. The coffee was just okay, but the brunch was delicious, and the portions were satisfying. We enjoyed our time. We appreciated the service. We'd consider returning. Overall, a nice spot to escape the heat and relax over a meal.
reviews.author: Reza Rad

reviews.text:
We visited Tartinery for a Sunday girls brunch because of the great location and amazing reviews, and it did not disappoint! We made a reservation before hand, and although Resy only allows 6 people, I called in and they were able to adjust it to 8.

We ordered the tartines, which were very filling - I appreciated that they were cut into pieces for easy consumption. I really liked the mandarin spritz, but my friends didn’t like the watermelon spritz. It’s a typical French place so everything felt healthy and fresh, even the French toast was interesting and different from the ones you’ll get at a regular diner. This felt a level up in terms of quality.

Would recommend!

reviews.text:

The staff were very slow and it took them 45 mins to bring our food. Other than that amazing chill weekend brunch spot. I highly recommend the smoked salmon. The french toast was great too.

reviews.text:
Altogether, in my opinion this place gets 4 stars.
The food was 10/10 hands down. My man loved this spot too. I been telling him let’s come here for the longest lmao. I am a hot oil snob, so they did well there. The spicy fried chicken and fried rice was just perfect.
The service here is confusing. They don’t instruct you how to order. Supposedly you can also order on the other side where you pick what you can get in a bowl? Then at the table you order via their barcode app thing? It’s confusing and they don’t instruct you unless you ask. I think they should from the walk in.

But other than that it was all good. Lots of students all around. But definitely is a cute date night spot. Would definitely come back at least once or twice more. I’d eat here alone too on a day my boyfriend is running late from work or something hehe.

reviews.text:
If you are near Greenwich village, you gotta check out Sotc. This Yunnan spot is legit. The dishes look amazing , but they taste even better. They’ve got so many noodles soup to choose from, but the Yunnan Crossing Bridge Rice Noodles with tender beef is so good. The  Dai-style stir fried beef is so flavorful with a slightly spicy. And you gotta try their Steamed Pot Chicken Soup. They made it fresh daily , simmer for long time to ensure the rich and authentic flavors .

Highly recommended especially the winter season is coming soon.

Featuring
Smoked Pork Chop ( Neck )
Signature Yunnan Crossing Bridge Rice Noodles
Dai Style Stir Fried Beef
Sour Cabbage Boiled Fish
Fried Shrimp Cake
Steamed Pot Chicken Soup
Tofu Pudding Dry Rice Noodles
Fresh Coconut Water
Handmade Coconut Jelly
Coconut Juice with tapioca
reviews.author: Cheryl Pink

reviews.text: A favorite haunt of local students that stands the test of time. The noodles are as good as I remembered them to be. Definitely the best place to get Yunnan cuisine/rice noodles in Manhattan.
reviews.author: Sophie Zhuang

reviews.text:
Well, they don't let you do your own cooking of the Yunnan Crossing Bridge noodles anymore. It's all pre-cooked in the stone pot. Sigh. It's tasty, don't get me wrong, and they give you a lot of stuff--but I was looking forward to making my own rice noodles.

The House Special Braised Noodle was better, though it's soup-less, so keep that in mind on these cold nights.

My disappointment in my noodz was somewhat alleviated by the gloriously spicy and juicy Hot and Sour Pomelo Shrimp. This dish was undoubtedly inspired by Thailand, but whatever, I love pomelo and will always enjoy chili and fruit. And once it got to the point of my mouth being on fire, the refreshing Ice Honey Cucumber Juice was a nice balm.
reviews.author: Josephine Lee

reviews.text:
all of the food was incredibly flavorful, even the traditionally more milder dishes were still packed with flavor. the interior was beautifully decorated and the staff very lovingly decorated the restaurant with halloween decorations for this season.

we loved the yunnan fried tofu with the super soft interior and perfectly fried outside, the best texture combination in our opinions. the deep fried short ribs had so much flavor and paired perfectly with the lime. the highlight of the meal, the yunnan signature crossing bridge had some of the most tender meat along with the soothing soup that was much needed on a cold day. the portions were pretty big and the food was filling.

Reviewer: Caitlin K

reviews.text: Hands down one of the best cafes that I have been to. Their food is so fresh and the service is exceptional. They have a great selection of dishes on their menu as well as smoothies, juices, and alcholic beverages. I guarantee that you will find something that you like. My favorites are the nachos and the veggie burger. I definitely recommend stopping in and giving it a try!

reviews.text: Love the look and feel of this beautiful corner spot . Lots of seating and fresh foods .. however I was disappointed with my salad . Another thing I noticed is that lots of people were sitting doing work but there aren’t many plugs . Maybe they are trying to discourage that if that’s the case then I understand . Also they only had lemonade & tea . Wish there was some sort of caffeinated beverage you could get .  Very clean spot though . So go see what you think . Maybe I ordered the wrong thing ;)

The beer menu is overwhelmingly large, and they have more ciders than I've seen anywhere else in NYC. A good menu for bar bites and food, which is pretty good for bar food. The decorations here are great though, keep an eye out for bottle cap versions of all sorts of famous paintings.

reviews.text: I had a fantastic experience at Irving Farm in New York! The ambiance is warm and inviting, perfect for a relaxing coffee break. Their cappuccino was superb, and the pastries were fresh and delicious. The staff was friendly and attentive, making me feel right at home. Highly recommend this spot for anyone looking to enjoy a quality cup of coffee and a peaceful atmosphere!
reviews.author: Hovhannes Hakobyan

reviews.text: Irving Farm New York is a coffee shop that offers excellent lattes in a prime location, making it a convenient stop for commuters and tourists alike. The quality of the coffee is top-notch, with expertly crafted lattes that are sure to satisfy even the most discerning palates. However, one potential downside is the limited seating available, which can fill up quickly, especially during peak hours. Despite this, the cafe's delicious lattes and friendly service make it a must-visit for coffee enthusiasts in the area.

reviews.text: Celebrated our 10 year anniversary here! Outstanding caviar and really enjoyed the tartar - the jazz was amazing too!! Super nice ambiance. Martinis are the best.

reviews.text: First time at The Nines, and it didn't disappoint. Be ready to spend $$$$ but it's worth it. The staff were very friendly, the food was good and drinks strong. The live jazz makes it a great experience.
reviews.author: Ronal Arevalo

reviews.text: Loved dining here! Our server, Ollie, gave great service and was very kind and attentive. Caviar baked potato was the best!! The atmosphere was top tier. Everyone was dressed nicely- laughing and having a great time. Each musician that played was exceptional and the volume was appropriate so that even though we were seated next to the piano, we could hear each other talk. We will be back!
reviews.author: Cassidy Wood

reviews.text: what a freaking fabulous location, food, vibe, feel, entertainment, and service! it was my first time here last night seeing Joey Arias perform. I can’t wait to come back. Everything is exquisite. Truly top-notch!
reviews.author: Downtown Playboy

reviews.text: We had a fantastic time celebrating a birthday at the Nines. The atmosphere was sexy and moody with great lighting and music. The service was spectacular, greeted with a happy birthday, they accommodated us bringing a cake ($5 fee/person) they added candles, coordinated a round of cocktails paid by family member over the phone in advance! The martinis and manhattans were perfection and served with your own overflow pitcher on ice. The burger and steak were delicious and not too large. I would absolutely return, to make any night feel like a really special occasion.
reviews.author: Courtney Day

reviews.text: Everything we expected. Classic cocktail dinner setting. The music was hard to hear but still added to the ambience. Service was great. Amazing vibes all...

If you're thinking about coming here for cocktails, don't. 

As walk ins, the friendly host was able to sit us at a table by the front bar. The cocktail...

reviews.text: We came in on a Monday night expecting it to be slow- it was bustling! From start to finish the entire staff was wonderful. Beautiful ambiance. The...
reviews.author: Meg M.

reviews.text:
Great place! We were just walking around in Union Square and found this gem by accident!

Very friendly staffs! Great price (especially considering the location! lol)

We loved the pita and olive served before the meal was really good. (Not familiar with Mediterranean Food but I beleive it is Pita, but was more chewy and oily, texture than what we usually ate but GOOOD)

The portion was huge, half of them we take back home. We had PSITA, MIXED GRILL PLATTER. Ordered 1 but as you can see in the picture, it' more than enough for 2. SPANAKI ME SKORDO (sautéed spinach with garlic) was also great! Sparkling water was excellent!

We looked over next table, the octopus looked AMAZING as well! 😆

Definately coming back for fish!

Overall, for us- it was a little bit Salty but maybe that's because we thrive for low sodium diet.

Overall, highly recommend!
reviews.author: Lisa L. Sealy

reviews.text: Great spot for very good greek food. The location is great if you like to sit outside. The staff is well trained and friendly.  We had a wonderful evening on our last night in NYC.
reviews.author: Lorna Cole

reviews.text:
Came here in 2021 and was hoping that it would live up to my memories and it absolutely did! Great to order a bunch of dishes and share with the table.
Loved the feta phyllo and both dips we got were amazing, especially the tzatziki. Would always come back!
reviews.author: Katie Hirthler

reviews.text: I’ve been wanting to visit Village Taverna for years and finally went with a friend for lunch this week. The food was delicious and well prepared and the portions are generous - both of us had leftovers (which were great the next day too). Service is friendly and the interior is very pretty. Will absolutely return to try more of their menu!
reviews.author: Jennifer Manzo

reviews.text:
We want to this restaurant for my birthday and it was so good ! The food is great ! (Real Greek food!!) and so tasty for the price ! Great place to share appetizers with a group !

Also the people who work there are so nice! Great service. I will come back for sure to try other dishes !!
reviews.author: Lena Wyzlic

reviews.text: The best Mediterranean place in the city! Great vibes, portions and price! Great for takeout as well.
reviews.author: Caroline B.

reviews.text: Absolutely amazing. I was in the area and I wandered in. What a flag of good luck. Greek cuisine always pulls at my taste buds. I had the lamb shank with...
reviews.author: Joseph B.

reviews.text:
Literally one of the best Greek salads in NYC...if not the best. 

Great neighborhood mainstay.
reviews.author: Andrew B.

reviews.text:
Had their Chicken Malai Roll - costed about 11$ (in cash). It tasted good, but would not say that it was the best Kolkata kathi roll in New York.
Had kathi rolls at the Kathi Roll Company (Bryant Park) and at Chote Miya (Chelsea Market) as well. Would rank the rank the Kathi Roll we had here at the last in terms of taste and price. Felt that it was a little on the pricier side given that the other places price the same item much less but are more flavorful. Nonetheless, it is a good option if you are craving a Kolkata kathi roll and this is the easiest option, then give it a try.
It's a small place, so very limited seating space available.
Also paying by cash costs a little less than paying by credit card.
reviews.author: Aishwarya Majumdar

reviews.text: My go to Indian food spot in west village!! They make your food really quickly and it is always delicious. Cute spot in a great location. Sitting area is very small so I would recommend getting to go if you’re with a group! Chai is okay.
reviews.author: Shriya Kakde

reviews.text: I come from Telangana in India, a state that prizes itself in authentic delicious and extremely spicy food. But what I got here was some sort of vengeance from the cooks. The amount of green chillis in the phal roll was absurd. The cooks made it with an agenda to burn me. There was no flavor and I was simply assaulted with green chilies. If an ulcer is what the owner means with 🔥🔥 rating then I think he or she or they needs to desperately try what they are serving and not simply hand over their store to cooks who have no idea what a Kathi roll means. Worst experience in NY and will never let anyone I know ever go there.
reviews.author: Akshay Gangoli

reviews.text: Great taste, we ordered bhel puri which was classic, Paneer khati roll, achari aloo kathi roll which was much better than others.

reviews.text:
I was so excited to find this place while wandering the area on a Sunday afternoon. There is nothing quite like delicious, hot French fries, and the added bonus of a variety of dipping sauces made this over the top perfect.

Fries were unbelievably good! The cheese sauce was a favorite, and the honey mustard and bbq were good as well. The black truffle was pretty heavy on the garlic, so I would not order that one again next time.

Highly recommend!!
reviews.author: Jackie Adler

reviews.text: Frites were delicious! Came out pipping hot but took a little too long to get to us (even when the place wasn’t busy) so just be prepared to wait a little. Loved all the sauces so absolutely try at least a choke of them!
reviews.author: Ujesh Vora

reviews.text: I think the hype for this place has died down since I got my order at 6 PM without any line. The fries were pretty good: not the most amazing fried potatoes you'll ever eat, but way better than most. What makes this place amazing seems to be the sauce selection (note: you have to pay any that's not a basic condiment): I got the Aji Verde sauce and it was one of the best sauces I've had.
reviews.author: Jonathan Chiou

reviews.text: Hidden gem in west village close to Washington Square park, had the best Belgian fries here - thick and crunchy from the outside, perfect soft and sweet from the inside! They also have 30+ amazing sauces to go with the fries which just makes the experience so much fun!!
reviews.author: Harshit Verma

reviews.text:
Pommes Frites in Greenwich Village is an absolute adventure for french fry enthusiasts! Step into this fry haven and get ready for a culinary journey with their double-cooked, authentic Belgian fries. These fries are super fresh, perfectly crisp, and fried in clean oil, making each bite a delight.

But the real adventure begins with their incredible selection of over 30 mouth-watering sauces. It’s like a flavor playground where you can mix and match to discover your perfect combination. From classic choices to bold, exotic flavors, there’s something for every palate.

The place is so poults that at one point the place burned down due to a gas leak and the neighborhood pitched in to help the restaurant get back on its feet.

The atmosphere has a fun, Game of Thrones vibe, adding a touch of epic fantasy to your fry experience. If you’re a fan of fries and sauces, Pommes Frites is your ultimate destination. This place is a must-visit in Greenwich Village for anyone looking to embark on a tasty and adventurous fry quest!
reviews.author: Steve M.

reviews.text:
Really great experience! They were super nice and let us sample the sauces before we ordered. Very friendly staff.

Delicious food. Ordering delicious fries...

Pomme Frites hits every time! 

As a person who grew up on Friday Friet in the Netherlands, I can truly say these fries taste just like home! Ambiance is...

Decent fries with good variety of sauce available.
Parmesan and herb on top makes it even better.
Everything felt fresh and flavors were well rounded.
Fries...

reviews.text: Delicious. Ordered via Uber Eats and over ordered the first time. Just had another order delivered and it is absolutely delicious again. Sesame Chicken and Rice noodles are so tasty, well balanced and would recommend them. Yum
reviews.author: Charlotte Batchelor

reviews.text:
We wondered in without reservations On a Saturday night about 7:30 and were seated immediately. The restaurant was clean and the staff was attentive, friendly and helpful. Prices were reasonably for the amount and quality of the food. The egg drop soup was tasty and not overly hot. The servers came around often to fill water early but as the night went on, they were around less, possibly attending to closing duties. The entree, chicken with broccoli,  was good and filling. My wife had a mixed vegetables plate and was not happy. Some of the vegetables were cold. It is possible that is how they are served.

All and all, it was our first time but our cousins second visit. We would 100% go again.
reviews.author: Mark Krug

reviews.text: Food and atmosphere was good. But service was not up to the mark. Also, there was a social media discount posted at the reception but they didn't honor it.
reviews.author: Swati Seth

reviews.text: I’d had the hardest time finding good quality sesame chicken that was not too chewy or fatty. This is excellent white meat chicken with the perfect batter and sauce ratio. Generous portion and comes with rice and broccoli. Delivered quickly and was hot on arrival. Definitely recommend.
reviews.author: Rachel K

reviews.text:
Disappointing dining experience. I checked the google reviews and came here specifically to eat the ginger scallion lobster. If there’s a photo published, you would think it’s on the menu. I asked the waiter if we could order, and he said we needed to reserve it in advance.

I decided to still stay and eat, since we trekked all the way here for dinner. Ordered the dumpling soup, egg rolls, chicken wings for starters. Overall sub-par quality and taste was not good.

Moving on to the entree, the double cooked pork and green beans. All the photos may look good, but the flavor was lacking. Tasted like they forgot a few spices per dish or something.

Presentation was all there, clean restaurant, nice tables, good service, the food was even photogenic. However, when it comes to the taste test, failed beyond my expectations.

Don’t recommend coming here if you’re looking for authentic Chinese food.

I ate here with a friend in the afternoon last week. The restaurant which is clean and modern, was fairly empty,
We ordered the spareribs, which were very...

reviews.text: I don’t know if I came at the perfect time or what, but this food was official! My friend and I both got their popular, The Box Combo. My order came out in less than 5 minutes, and was piping HOT! My favorite thing had to be the Texas toast! It was so soft, and fresh. And it had the most perfect garlic butter taste! Only thing was that it was a little crowded, but I didn’t mind because I took my food to go.

reviews.text: I got the box with 4 tenders and lemonade. The lemonade was really good! I liked the pebbly ice. The chicken box was delicious too! Chicken was super juicy and ok on its own but amazing with the canes sauce. Also the fries and coleslaw were both really good too.

reviews.text: The only negative visiting this location was the chicken fingers were more on the soggy side instead of crispy. Otherwise the food and beverages were delicious as usual.

reviews.text: I got the box combo, 4 chicken tenders with fries, toast, coleslaw, sauce, and drink. Chicken tenders were tasty and crispy, overall just a tasty meal. The seating area does get packed during lunch, but it is generally clean.
reviews.author: Shane S.

reviews.text: I’m not kidding this is the best raising canes in the whole world. The people here were so nice. It was clean and not as hectic as Times Square. I went to the Times Square location and they were so rude. They were so genuinely nice I cannot describe it. Made me feel welcomed and that is not common in New York. Thank you canes and the food as always delicious. The workers told me I could even sub something out if I didn’t want it and I’ve been to canes all over the US and no canes has ever told me that. So thank you and follow my food account if you got this far @exploringwithjaylynn

reviews.text: Raising Cane's reigns supreme as top-notch fast food. The quality has remained consistent over the many years I have eaten it and as a Southerner, I'm very...

reviews.text:
OMG! The best Georgian food I have ever had in USA! I had Khinkali, Mushroom Pie, Kada and Honey cake!
Everything was delicious, fresh, tasted like homemade and you can tell they are using quality ingredients. I can’t say enough great things about this place! If you ever in the area don’t hesitate to stop by and try something new. There is a menu on the wall that explains every dish, for customers who are not familiar with Georgian cuisine. I am definitely coming back to try their Kubdari!
reviews.author: Kristina Gambarian

reviews.text: Wow! Absolutely loved this place! Don’t let the low key, casual atmosphere distract you from the amazing quality and homemade authentic Georgian food. I highly recommend for affordable and authentic Georgian
reviews.author: Anastasiia Okuneva

reviews.text: I have been saving this place for so long! Finally, I tried, and I'm super satisfied. The boat cheese was amazing, and beet balls were interesting. It's always a pleasure to try something new. It's a small cute place, but it still has many seats + very kind service. I'd like to come back again, and I definitely recommend to try!
reviews.author: Hyunser Park

reviews.text:
A warm local Georgian place which is owned by a super friendly and easy going owner with a simple but cute decor. The service is also great with the owner happy to recommend the dishes.

I wanted to tick off the traditional Georgian dish, Adjaruli Khachapuri. It's basically a bread boat filled with cheese and raw egg yolk. It's a  baked dish and is best eaten when hot. One needs to mix the raw egg yolk properly within the cheese and then devour it. The bread was easy to break with crisp sides while the cheese was really creamy and smooth. It basically felt like a better version of NYC cheese pizza minus the marinara, and I would happily choose this one over pizza! The dish is simple, filling and soul satisfying which made me love it. The prices too are pretty decent compared to the neighborhood they are located in.

Overall an amazing experience with Georgian food, would definitely come back to try their Khinkali (dumplings) next time!
reviews.author: Sanchit Kamath

reviews.text:
The first place that I had Georgian food and I love them so much! Definitely going back again soon.

The ✨🍳🧀Adjaruli Khachapuri, the “egg & cheese boat” thing was mind blowing..! The cheese was sooooo creamy and smooth. But better finish it while it is hot.

🥧Kubdari which is a meat pie, rich and huge. The bread was soft with a tiny-little-bit crispy edge. The meat was well seasoned. Tasted really good.

For dessert I HIGHLY recommend their 🍯honey cake. It was soft, moist, and creamy. No too sweet.

The last we had was the Churchkhela. Have to be honest, not my thing, it was really too unique for me. But I can tell its kinda a health snack. It was chewy.

reviews.text:
(Updated 2019)

Understocked, understaffed, and overpriced and refuse coupons because it's not the right day or they're not allowing them anymore or they have a "deal" going on for an item but when I pay its the same price. Cashier on Wednesday is also rude af.

Update: Came back to get a salad because it’s quick and nearby to where I was, a chopped chicken Caesar salad. Didn’t think it’d be a problem, because I’ve gotten it at other Subways and have been wholly satisfied with the quality. Was horrendous compared to the other ones. Not only did they skimp on the dressing to barely cover a corner, the chicken looked mangled and destroyed, the tomatoes tasted bruised, wasn’t even chopped, and they didn’t seem to care for croutons that usually came with the salad. (Pictured) Their sandwiches are usually alright, not great, but I don’t know what happened here.

reviews.text:

I take Subway food around 3 or 4 times and she was saying that she cannot cut it. There is no way, this is the new method now. We don't cut vegetables now. reviews.text: Our outside table was elegant, with white tablecloth and fresh roses, not much street noise, and easy on-street parking. The food was fabulous! Best mussels ever--with white wine, fennel, thyme, and crusty bread. The antipasto was delicious. My sweetie had the Burrata pizza and loved it. We had Pana cotta and pistachio gelato for dessert--yum! The excellent servers were nice and just-the-right-amount of attentive. We will be back!
reviews.author: Eliza S

reviews.text: Incredibly flavorful pasta dishes. We were satisfied with both dishes we had and their portion sizes (pretty decent). This is definitely one of the more cost effective yet authentic Italian places in Greenwich Village, would recommend.
reviews.author: Joey Misiaszek

reviews.text:
We stopped here on a whim, and had a wonderful time. Morrow was the host and he suggested the one that was good. I had Baratta with vegetables and the cheese was a good quality. My wife had arugula salad. I had the rigatoni with sausage, and it was delicious and my wife had the. Flounder, with roasted potatoes.

It’s a real scene because you’re watching people walk by and it’s like watching a TV show to see all the different characters but of course we ate outside.

The bathroom is downstairs if that’s a problem for you. All in all the food was good, the service was good, and it was a nice place. I would go here again.

I forgot to tell you, but we had fresh fruit for dessert. Much better than a fattening dessert.
reviews.author: Philip J

reviews.text: One of the only places to eat in the west village that isn’t extremely packed table to table. I liked the atmosphere. The service was amazing. For the price though, the food didn’t wow me. It was really good…just didn’t equate the price.
reviews.author: Jimena G

reviews.text: I’ve been going here numerous times a month for a good bit. Made a reservation for a 7 pm dinner this past week, but my friend was about 45 minutes early. The entire restaurant, both inside and out, was empty. She asked if she could order a glass of champagne while she waited and use the restroom, but before the hostess could answer, the manager that was seated in the back yelled across the restaurant- “not possible”, without even so much as getting up to explain. He followed it up with- “we’re booked w/ reservations”. She let him know she’d get up as soon as they had a table, but yet again, no professional courtesy- not a handshake, not even the respect to stand up to speak to a patron.  He yelled from the back again “Nope”. Needless to say, we canceled our reservation & left a message for the manager (who never returned the call). Here are the pictures of the completely empty restaurant, both at 6:10 PM, and an hour and 20 minutes later. Again, not one single table in the whole place. Sidebar, when I went to their online reservation platform, every single timeslot came up as available. It’s almost like the manager on duty didn’t want business and just wanted to close early. It’s a shame, and disappointed by the lack of customer service to not even get so much as a phone call back.
reviews.author: D Gill

reviews.text: The restaurant is small but cute and intimate. We had a reservation for four on a Sunday night and it was quite packed but they sat us immediately. The...

Complete failure of (other platform) reviews once again!

This is a mediocre neighborhood Italian restaurant. There's nothing "cozy" about sitting in a...
