reviews.text: Very cute neighborhood spot with lots of history and charm. Think perfect for a fancy evening out or date night since it has romantic/ comfy vibes....
reviews.author: Tory C.

reviews.text: This is the first time i tried Omakase Sushi set menu and i have to say this was one of the BEST sushi eating experiences of my life! The quality the precision was mind blowing. Highly trained chef’s prepare the best, light , absolutely delicious sushi’s while explaining you everything they serve you. They also change the ingredients if you are allergic to anything or don’t want that particular ingredient in your sushi. It was so simple no nonsense pure good food and delicious, authentic sushi experience of my life. I highly recommend this place NYC.
reviews.author: Shama Sikander

reviews.text: I recently dined at Shiki for their $65 omakase menu. The atmosphere was inviting, and the presentation of each dish was visually stunning. The selection of fish was ok, and the flavors were mostly delightful. However, I did find that the rice in a few pieces was not fully cooked, which was disappointing for an omakase experience. The service was attentive and friendly, which added to the overall positive experience. While there's room for improvement with the rice, Shiki still offers a good sushi experience with unbeatable price.
reviews.author: Kim Hong

reviews.text: Let me just start and say… This place was a gem with amazing quality of food, flavors of taste and service. It is small but the lighting and decor of the restaurant still makes it feel spacious. I chose the $65 option and I loved every single piece. First they ask if you have any allergies and if you’re ok with spice. You are served piece by piece after eating and you do not feel rushed at all; as previous reviews have mentioned. Seriously,  it really shouldn’t take you more than an hour to enjoy 12 pieces unless other circumstances occur.. The chef hands you a piece and tells you the piece and ingredients. After you finish the piece, he casually turns over and asks for your opinion (at least mine did). Each piece had such delicate and  flavorful combinations together. As I was almost close to my 12 piece, the lovely waitress comes over to ask if there might be any additional items I want to add and proceeds to show me some add on items. Of course, I want to add! I added another oyster with negitoro and uni because let me tell you, the first piece that the chef served was the oyster and the sweetness that came with that ocean flavor just opened up all of my food buds! That was a great start for ones palate. The chef even threw in the last scallop dish for me to try! It says reservations only, so call beforehand just in case. Oh and their rice was NOT undercooked at all when I went. This restaurant was definitely a win for me and a must try!
reviews.author: Lisa Chan

reviews.text: Great spot for omakase. We got the 17 course option and loved it! It’s a quick one hour dinner, so not great for first dates. However, if you want to grab drinks after highly recommend bar Moga two blocks away
reviews.author: Martina Ruseva

reviews.text: From NY to Osaka, this is some of the best sushi I have had in my experience. Pure delight. Not a bottle of mayonnaise in sight! IYKYK. Well worth it and I will come again.
reviews.author: James Milliron

reviews.text: Amazing sushi!! We went late and had the place to ourselves.  It was their third anniversary so they gave us each a bottle of sake.
reviews.author: Pat M.

reviews.text: Coming from LA, omakase is on average $250, so when we visited NYC we knew we'd have to have omakase before we left. I had friends who have gone to Shiki...
reviews.author: Christine H.

reviews.text:
One of my favorite sushi place!  I get the regular and then add on my favorite specials!  I even celebrated my birthday here with my sister!

Their sushi is...
reviews.author: Bing R.

reviews.text:
Great bar, great prices, great music. Anything else I didn’t mention?

It’s a bar. Expect the floors to be sticky, and bathrooms to be untended. As long as the drinks are flowing- who cares?

There’s a nice sitting area, dancing area; and a bar area. I would return 120%
reviews.author: Shiv Patel

reviews.text: Came in with some friends on a Sunday night, had a fantastic time. Decor and vibe of the bar is wonderful, loved exploring all of the little details throughout. Service was impeccable and drinks were great. Highly recommend checking out, I’ll be back next time I’m in town 💙⚓️
reviews.author: Nicole Longenecker

reviews.text:
Great happy hour spot! It's available Monday through Friday until 8 pm. You can get all-well drinks, beer on tap, a delicious painkiller frozen drink, and wine for just $8.

It's also a fantastic place to host a gathering. I've been here for birthdays before, and the pirate ship-themed decor is really cool.
reviews.author: Cindy W

reviews.text: One of my friend groups favorite bars in NYC! Came here to start the night for my birthday. When there was a mixup with my reservation, Jon and Jess went above and beyond to make sure we had a great experience. This place has amazing drinks, service, food and atmosphere. Can’t recommend it enough!
reviews.author: Samantha K

reviews.text:
we love $8 drinks until 8pm (applies to all drafts, one kind of white, red, and rose, and the frozen painkiller)

it was kind of loud when we came at 7pm ish on a thursday but wasn’t fighting for my life to hear my friend talk or anything. (i felt like we were fighting for our lives to get the bartenders attention though)
reviews.author: Cindy Hao

reviews.text: We had an incredible Halloween at The Folly, huge thanks to AJ and John! They brought fantastic energy and kept everything running smoothly for our group of...
reviews.author: Nikita G.

reviews.text: Despite my last review I went back to the Folly and did not regret it! The owner reached out to me apologize which I really did appreciate, so I gave it...
reviews.author: Jessica M.

reviews.text: Great happy hour spot! It's available Monday through Friday until 8 pm. You can get all-well drinks, beer on tap, a delicious painkiller frozen drink, and...
reviews.author: Cindy W.

reviews.text: We came to enjoy the lunch special and it was incredible! Seriously the best pasta I’ve ever had. I had the fettuccine fungi and it was outstanding and delicious. Also the bread was made fresh daily and the homemade sun dried tomato and roasted garlic sauce with herbs that come with it was addicting. Overall the atmosphere inside is lovely, good music, very well decorated and clean. The food was served in a timely manner and Mario was able to help us with any questions or customizations we wanted. We ended up getting drinks at the bar and Ahmad’s service matched his excellence in creating our drinks. This has quickly become my new favorite restaurant in New York City for its ability to check every box for me.
reviews.author: Teralyn Ubico

reviews.text:
Delicious and authentic.
We sat at the bar and had a wonderful dinner. We made a reservation but there was room for walk ins as well.
All of the staff we encountered were Italian and so lovely. The food was very delicious and authentic to southern Italy.
The complimentary sun dried tomatoes in olive oil were a nice surprise - we asked for more and put it on the other dishes we ordered it was so good!
reviews.author: Sarah Stewart

reviews.text: Really cute place with good service and good food. We came here by chance after happy hour nearby and were impressed. Our server was kind and attentive. She helped with recommendations and they took dietary restrictions and allergies seriously. The lemon risotto with shrimp was fantastic. Friends also really enjoyed their pastas. Drinks and wine were really good, not bad prices for the neighborhood. We’ll be back again to try the rest of the menu.
reviews.author: Meredith Jane

reviews.text:
Nestled in the heart of the city, Mr. Capri offers an unforgettable dining experience that effortlessly combines exquisite cuisine with an inviting ambiance. From the moment you step through the door, you're greeted with warm, friendly service that sets the tone for the evening.

The décor strikes a perfect balance between chic modernity and cozy comfort, making it ideal for both intimate dinners and lively gatherings. Soft lighting, tasteful art pieces, and comfortable seating arrangements create a relaxing yet sophisticated atmosphere that makes you feel at home instantly.

But the true star of Mr. Capri is the food. Each dish is a testament to culinary artistry, crafted with fresh, high-quality ingredients and presented with impeccable attention to detail. The menu offers a delightful array of options, catering to diverse palates while maintaining a focus on innovative flavors.

The appetizers set the stage beautifully; the Burrata is a must-try, bursting with flavor and perfectly seasoned.

In addition to the fantastic food and ambiance, the staff at Mr. Capri deserve special mention. Their knowledge of the menu and genuine enthusiasm enhance the dining experience, making you feel valued and well-cared-for throughout your visit.

Overall, Mr. Capri is more than just a place to eat—it's a destination where food, atmosphere, and service come together in perfect harmony. Whether you're a local or a visitor, this restaurant promises an evening of culinary delight that will leave you eager to return.

They also have a sister Restaurant Boca, that is also a must try!
reviews.author: Natalia Gordon

reviews.text: I went here after work because I heard the food was so good and it definitely is. There are plenty of vegan options, I prefer to send the bar because I think you get better service. Everyone's really nice and they even had a wonderful Sauvignon Blanc by the glass for me. Not sure what time to tell you to go to avoid the clouds but I was there around 7:30. I had no problem getting service at the bar, although if you like they can definitely give you a table. You may want to make reservations though because some people were waiting about 15 minutes for a table.
reviews.author: char sidney

reviews.text: My wife and I recently got married at Jefferson Market Garden, followed by our wedding reception at Mr. Capri. We couldn't have asked for a more perfect...
reviews.author: Nick P.

reviews.text:
Classy Italian restaurant with good happy hour deals.

The rigatoni pasta was unfortunately a really small portion, but it was delicious. The texture of the...
reviews.author: Sophia W.

reviews.text: Had the best time here after stumbling upon it after dinner! Sat at the bar with a friend and the drinks were amazing. The celery root drink is so...
reviews.author: Brianna F.

reviews.text: Love their vibe. Service is great and we particularly enjoyed their broccoli and spaghetti. Their cocktails named after Italian cities are also nice. Would come back to try their pizzas.
reviews.author: Beth Luan

reviews.text:
Somehow casual and upscale at the same time, speedy but not rushed service, and affordable yet delicious and well designed dishes.

Vic’s is a great spot with all around everything you need or want for great dinner.
reviews.author: Jasraj Singh

reviews.text:
Vic’s

Layout/atmosphere
*Bar area on left side before hostess stand; tables/wooden booths (flowers, plants, intimate lighting); skylight/open kitchen in back; zebra wallpaper in bathroom; tables on sidewalk; enclosed outdoor dining structure in street

Service
*All wore blue, denim button down shirts with aprons; attentive

Food/drink
*Pinot Grigio (Elena Welch, Alto Adige 2023) - liked it; dry
*Burrata (persimmon, pickled mustard seed, lemon, tarragon, mint, torn bread) - burrata creamy; toasted bread (some kind of grains or seasoning on top); sweetness of persimmon
*Squid Ink Spaghettini (shrimp, tomato, calabrian chili, parsley) - pasta cooked well; heat from chili; hint of lemon or some kind of citrus
reviews.author: Daniel Pino

reviews.text: Delicious brunch by Chef Andy! We had the Ricotta Pancake which was just the right amount of sweet. All of the pasta dishes we tried were absolutely memorable meals with amazing flavors. We'll be returning to try more! Thanks to the staff for being so kind and friendly!
reviews.author: Welby Montalvo

reviews.text:
Had dinner at Vic’s with my friends. Overall everything was great but not like "you should definitely check it out!!!!" Although it was Monday dinner, the place was very crowded and we had to wait a long time for the next dish to come out.. which was kinda annoying.. the server was super nice though.. The ambiance was nice but too loud and packed so we literally had to shout to one another .

We started with the crudo. The dish was very refreshing. We got Vodka pizza since the server HIGHLY Recommended but honestly wasnt super special, somewhat disappointing.. we also got potato pizza. The server introduced as a new menu and the potato pizza would be what i would recommend.

for pasta, we got cacio e pepe and it was again good but nothing too special.. I think I saw their rainbow cookies are amazing on Instagram.. so of course we ordered that and it was good, but again nothing special

The service was friendly so I really wanted to write a good review. Well it was a good dining experience but i would not say that i'd come back or recommend to other people. If you live in the city and just wanna check it out, it's worth it but if you are visiting, there are so many better italian places out there. Or maybe my expectations were too high.
reviews.author: S P

reviews.text:
Food was amazing.  As well as the service & the ambiance was very nice!  

Def a 5 star establishment that god above & Beyond!   

Thanks for a great night!
reviews.author: John J.

reviews.text:
AMAZING pizza, poached eggs with lamb belly

brisket sandwich was just ok

strong brunch cocktails

drip coffee is disappointing
reviews.author: Jeanie N.

reviews.text: What a solid spot! Perfect ambiance, great service, and delicious food. Was able to snag a Saturday night reservation and the restaurant was buzzing and...
reviews.author: Hannah B.

reviews.text: Ordered the mix meat combo over rice. The quality of the food was average but the amount was good. It was the first time I tried Sammy’s. The rice was delicious and the taste of lamb was good. The lamb surely tasted better than the chicken. I went for late lunch so the quality of the meat wasn’t very fresh in my opinion. It is good value for money. Would love to try other branches to find out how they are, overall It was good.
reviews.author: N R

reviews.text:
Came here to quickly grab a meal. Ordered combo over rice.

Quick Service: Meal was prepared in less than two minutes.

Taste: nothing extraordinary just the normal taste you would expect from any other cart!
reviews.author: J I

reviews.text: If you are near the park and want to eat something halal this can be the easiest street food you have access to.
reviews.author: Fet

reviews.text: Solid halal food and the pitas were pretty fresh as well. No complaints and I would eat here again honestly.
reviews.author: WKUK B

reviews.text: Ate at the 39th St location a block from Bryant Park yesterday, which I originally located on Google Maps. Today, I can't find it to save me. Anyway, I've never eaten at a halal joint before. The food was fresh, delicious, and plentiful for a very reasonable price. I had the shawarma beef and lamb platter that was deliciously spiced up for me on request. Wife had a chicken platter. Vegetables were fresh and nice. Rice was super long grain and also really good. There was plenty of meat in both platers. I'd eat there again in a second. Was around $20 for both generous platters and a couple drinks. No wait, and the gentleman that put this all together for us was super nice. Recommended.
reviews.author: Chris Hughes

reviews.text: Should've just tried the top halal cart in New York because when I came to this place, I put so much trust in it. Granted, he loaded up the box for the...
reviews.author: Tiffany L.

reviews.text: Enjoyed this place after a late night out and it was delicious and affordable. The service is great too!
reviews.author: Aalia S.

reviews.text: Typical halal. Nothing special here. Maybe if they had a better salad with lamb over rice they would gain a star. Food is also not fresh cooked on the grill...
reviews.author: Pok B.

reviews.text: I stopped here for lunch and enjoyed the shrimp tempura, pork katzu, and sushi. The service was pretty good and the prices were reasonable. The inside is a nice atmosphere as well. I would definitely return.
reviews.author: Dale Serbousek

reviews.text: I love this place!!!  The fish is fresh and their entrees are very reasonably price.  It is very rare that you go back somewhere and it was better than you remember.   It is my go to sushi place from now on.
reviews.author: Crystal Ng

reviews.text: Celebrated my cousin’s 21 birthday here and everything is fresh and so good! the staff is also very friendly they offered us some saké and helped us lightning the candle on the sushi platter :)) would really recommend if you want something feisty but personal and warm!
reviews.author: Maïlee Klamphosri

reviews.text: We were looking at the menu in the window and the manager came out to greet us. Staff is very friendly, everyone said hello on our way in and goodbye on our way out. Spicy kani salad and the short-rib appetizers were awesome. The rolls were incredible! They are very well priced and use the perfect amount of rice to emphasize the flavor of the fish & other ingredients. Our new favorite spot in NYC. Will certainly be back…often!
reviews.author: Kyle Supran

reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY OUTSTANDING!!!!!!!!! The best and freshest sushi and the most amazing crispy rice I’ve ever had in my life.  I work for an omakase in soho and a corporate sushi and seafood restaurant in meatpacking district and this hidden gem surprised me so much.  It really is A+++. The sushi chef Kevin really has a true passion for what he does and is a valuable asset to the whole operation.  Will be back soon !!

reviews.text: Walked in here by myself after a happy hour event! I needed food and quickly! I was seated immediately by the hostess, who was so friendly and sweet. Right...

We shared the scallion pancakes and dumplings. The scallion...

Food very freshly 
Staff a bit slow ... 
Place is okay .. 
seating very uncomfortable too small .

reviews.text: went here during PRIDE 🏳️‍🌈🏳️‍🌈🕺✨ so yummy!! 😋 especially loved the scallion noodles 🍜 and veggies dumplings 🥟.   included some pics below ⬇️ so you all can see just delicious it was! this placed saved me and my friends from HEAT EXHAUSTION, RAIN, and HUNGER.  shoutout shanghai villa, would def come again. 💋

reviews.text:
My brother dad and I came into Shanghai Villa for dinner. It was spectacular. The soup dumplings were incredible. The explosion of flavor is undescribable. The orange chicken was prepared in a fried style that I cannot say I've had before but was better than anything I'd had before.
The people were very kind and the service was good.
reviews.author: Benjamin Lawing (Ben's Kitchen)

reviews.text:
We intended to go to a restaurant 2-3 lots down the road but it was packed and we didn't want to wait. So we walked back here and decided to try. We were impressed with the food and the service. Unbelievable that it was not busy.  The background music was calm and we could have a conversation. We enjoyed our dinner here so much and would definitely come back again.

Went back the second time and the waiter remembered us right away which is impressive.
reviews.author: Bung

reviews.text: This is place is amazing! The service from the staff, the food is so tasty, the establishment is so clean and cute.

reviews.text: I really like the vegetarian dim sum options. They have vegetarian soup dumplings. The soy sheets were my favourite though. The owner is very nice

reviews.text: The most vegetarian and vegan friendly Shanghainese restaurant close to the NYU campus you'll ever find! Lots of options including seitan, buns, soy sheets,...

reviews.text: Do not come here for happy hour oysters! The oysters were small, tasted not super fresh, and in general were not great. I really liked their happy hour margarita though. Fried calamari was also pretty good. I also tried the mussels seafood boil, lobster roll, and soft shell crab basket on another occasion, thought everything was ok but nothing exceptional. Note that they are cash only.
reviews.author: Ellen Huang

reviews.text:
5 years ago I came to this place it was unforgettable! It was a very small restaurant but they did renovations and expand it but unfortunately the food is not the same :(
There used to be egg, sausage, potato and corn in the combo and now it’s only potato and corn. Flavor is not as rich neither
reviews.author: May Bentley

reviews.text: When you want something very delicious and spicy seafood you should go this places because everything is very fresh and 100% you can get satisfaction. We got some shrimp. Lobster comes with corn and potato.

reviews.text: The food was an amazing expérience, the service was excellent I even receive a little tutorial on how to eat a crow fish, the lady was so professional patient and kind. The boil sauce taste like heaven ✨ 10/10

reviews.text: Besttt seafood boil ever. Tastes exactly how I want, oysters were fresh and cocktails were delicious.

reviews.text: Went for my bday dinner. They easily accommodated a reservation for our party of 11. You order appetizers and seafood with a selected sauce and spice level....

reviews.text: I was so sad to find out that the Grand street location has been closed for awhile. This one is the only location in Manhattan (they have 1 in queens +...

reviews.text:
The food was pretty good to say the least.
Unfortunately the owners horrendous attitude and deminur spoiled everything that night. 
He was very obnoxious...
reviews.author: Kevin S.

reviews.text:
We had a great experience dining here, starting with the warm and inviting atmosphere. The restaurant is beautifully designed, creating a comfortable yet chic setting that's perfect for a relaxing meal.

Our server, Gustavo, was fantastic—attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable. He made sure we had everything we needed and offered great recommendations that really enhanced our meal.

The food was delicious, with fresh ingredients and thoughtful presentation. Every dish we tried was flavorful and satisfying, making it a memorable dining experience.

Overall, Margaux is a solid choice for anyone looking for a great meal in the city, with excellent service to match. We’ll definitely be back!
reviews.author: Matt Radcliffe

reviews.text: Well..this was one those not too great experiences but then someone saves the day kind of thing?? Came in here just because of how cozy it looks from outside.  Walked in, server sees me by the podium and walks away. I wanted to really try the place so I chased after him and asked to be seated. He looked bothered, but got a better attitude a bit later.  I get it: We all have bad days and dealing with the public is a pain! But then he went MIA. Gustavo, the bus boy/waiter saved the day. He took care of me and was on top of service one. A new waiter came in and was friendly though. The pros: beautiful space...the cons: innatentive service, average food, and unimpressive cocktails (Not everyone knows how to incorporate mezcal into a cocktail without overwhelming).  Wanted to love this place, but can't recommend in good faith..
reviews.author: MSP

reviews.text: Came here for post-work drinks with coworkers on a Tuesday evening. We sat in the front lounge area near the fireplace. It’s a really cute place. It feels like the library of an old school mansion. The wait service was not the best. They seemed annoyed to have to take our order. The French fries were pretty tasty though. Probably won’t come back. The cocktails were over $15 and not that great.
reviews.author: Jon Hayes

reviews.text:
Want to like this place but far too many issues.  The burger bun was stale, tough and inedible.  the service was horrid.  They brought entrees from another table to
Our table during our appetizers.  We asked for side salads with burgers and got fries.  Everything was slow.  Scallops were good.  Bucatini was ok, a bit over cooked and limp.  The winter salad was the highlight, standing out in a mediocre experience.
reviews.author: Trevor Sumner

reviews.text: Really enjoyed the food and the vibe - the scallops and the burrata were delicious, and their honey and ricotta shared plate was great too. Definitely on the pricier side though.
reviews.author: Nandini Mazumdar

reviews.text: Great, service!!!I love it everytime I come. I highly recommend and incredible food!!! Also the waiter Juan is awesome.
reviews.author: Zac K.

reviews.text: Food and drinks are decent for this cozy venue. If possible, sit in the more living/bar area vs the dining room. The ambiance is much better and the service...
reviews.author: Kara D.

reviews.text: I just waited forty minutes for someone to take my order--at which point, after a number of the waitstaff passed by with evidently zero interest in staking...

reviews.text: Best Mexican tacos come from this Best Mexican food truck located on corner of Washington Place & Broadway.  Freshly made to order and fresh taste including slice of pineapple, pickled onions, home made salsas green mild, hot, very hot.  Tender pieces of carnitas, carne asada, chicken — all put together deliciously!
reviews.author: tia cocopuffs

reviews.text: Accidentally stumbled on this place while walking down broadway. Service was exceptional and food was crazy good and fresh. Had to order multiple times to try out different salsas they got (all of which are amazing). Best mushroom tacos in NYC
reviews.author: Sagar Singh

reviews.text: The best food you'll have ever!!! Everything on their menu is to die for. Their meets are seasoned to perfection, their sauces are spicy and flavorful. I absolutely adore this place! I recommend trying their burritos, vampiros and mulitas the most.
reviews.author: Jameela Ayoub

reviews.text: Hands down the best tacos I've had outside of México. The birria mulita with crisp cheese on top is amazing. Great cochinita and chorizo as well. Quick & friendly service.
reviews.author: Magnus Pharao Hansen

reviews.text: Had the Conchinita Pibil taco. Best taco I’ve had in NYC since moving from CA 6 years ago. Truly something special here. Can’t wait to go back and try the mulita and vampiro tacos.
reviews.author: Amorelle Applin

reviews.text:
Steak burrito - $14 + tax

Wow great burrito, large, filling, the inside has a lot of different layers of flavors, like pico, guacamole, beans, etc... they...
reviews.author: Mike A.

reviews.text: behold a food truck with seating built-in! stopped at Habanero Pibil for some late-in-the-day takeout tacos. the Habanero Pibil truck must be popular bc...
reviews.author: Ruwan J.

reviews.text: Stopped by here on my way to a friend's birthday gathering and I really enjoyed my meal! So much ... I made a stop before heading home at the end of the...
reviews.author: Fredrika C.

reviews.text: Best sushi I've had in NY, which may not seem impressive given I haven't had much sushi here, but I've spent a life having a lot of great sushi in Seattle so my standards are high. I hadn't heard of this place, but we popped in for a late dinner.  Great space, very classy interior, just look at that picture, look how shiny and warm the wood looks. Anyway, I had some miso and split the Sushi & Sashimi for two with my dad. Not cheap, but well worth it for the quality, plus they don't skimp on the serving size. The fish was so good. Oh my god. The salmon?? The MACKEREL??? Probably added at least ten years to my life. Exceptional quality, the rolls too, all of it. All the staff were wonderful, they all said goodnight when we left. 10000/10. I'll be dreaming about it until I return.
reviews.author: Siena WD

reviews.text: We like the unadon. Give it a try if you like sweet food.
reviews.author: Tian Nan

reviews.text: Awesome sukiyaki, sushi, soft shell crab, age tofu, and miso soup. I would definitely recommend.
reviews.author: Charlene Auriel Lim

reviews.text: Walked in on a weekday for a post work dinner. I ordered the chirashi bowl and was pleasantly surprised with how much fit into this little bowl. The prices are about average for NYC, but the food is made well. The outside area is pretty cute too, but service was a bit limited out there.
reviews.author: Elizabeth T.

reviews.text: Japanese food cooked by Japanese people.  I’ve been dining here for nearly two decades.  Nowadays New York is a sixteen hour flight away, and no matter how long I am in town for- Marumi is always on my menu.  It is this warm anticipation that everything will be just perfect that pulls me back every time.  Hope our next encounter will not be too far away.
reviews.author: Elnur A

reviews.text:
Love this place. Favorite sushi/Japanese restaurant in the area - can't go wrong with the sushi or entrees. 

The staff is always very friendly.
reviews.author: Jake S.

reviews.text: We ordered the rainbow sake cocktail, ginger saketini, the sushi Jo, and the seafood miso nabe. The sake cocktails were sweet and tasty, and at $12 each, we...
reviews.author: Esther R.

reviews.text: This is a step above no frills in the best way! The Chef's Choice Sushi is priced very reasonably ($50 after tip and tax)!considering there is uni and toro....
reviews.author: Anna D.

reviews.text:
When you walk in it looks like a cafeteria with trays that you pick up. The instructions say to take a tray and tempura plate, you then tell the worker what soup you want and they give it to you on the spot then you move your tray along and take whatever tempura you want if you want it and then pay at the cash register. There is also a sauce making station that tells you how to mix the tempura sauce with radish paste.

The workers were all so nice and answered our questions on the way out every single person said good bye to us. The place is kept clean and there are two bathrooms in the back.

The noodles are so fresh, made there and you can taste it. The broth is too salty for me so I didn’t drink much of it. All the tempura was 50% of when we went so that was cool. I wish I was hungry enough to eat more. I wanted to try the mochi tempura. I got the chrysanthemum tempura not knowing what it was. It was delicious though, tasted like a veggie like broccoli rabe or asparagus but didn’t have much flavor. My friend got a soft boiled egg tempura, never had that either. It was interesting to eat tempura with a soft center and the egg was kind of sweet.

I would def come back here again. Very reasonably priced I think I paid about $10 for soup and tempura! I got the basic #1 soup.
reviews.author: Marisa

reviews.text:
What a great place to have freshly made Japanese udon and tempura! I was skeptical to try out this place because i recently visited  Japan and Hawaii for best authentic noodles. But I was surprised to taste freshly made udon noodles in NYC!
We loved cold udon so much. Noodles were bouncy and had nice texture. Assortments of Tempura were tasty. Beef bowl was substantial and seasoned well.
We ordered extra udon on the side and i think that was about $3.
There is a fixing station where you can get condiments and hot tea and iced water were complimentary. Staff are friendly.
We enjoyed the lunch and definitely coming back soon!
reviews.author: Amy Kang

reviews.text:
Sanuki Udon, located next to Washington Square Park, features an open kitchen where fresh noodles are crafted daily. Inspired by the Japanese eatery Marugame Udon, the experience begins with choosing your entree: rice or udon, served with soup or dry, alongside a variety of small plates, primarily tempuras.

The condiment area offers an array of options, including tempura flakes, minced garlic, ginger, and radish, perfect for enhancing your dish or creating a flavorful dipping sauce.

The fried shrimp and vegetable tempura are light and crispy, while the seating is clean and comfortable, ensuring a pleasant dining experience.
reviews.author: Vivian Lin

reviews.text:
Was actually very disappointed. It seems like whenever a franchise opens up a restaurant in nyc it’s usually not as good for some reason. I was super excited to try them because the one in Japan was great!

We went close to closing time around 7:30pm so maybe that could be why it wasn’t that fresh?

Curry katsu udon 2/5: do not reco getting this, barely any soup, udon too soft, and katsu was overly soggy from the curry

Beef udon 3.5/5: this was wayyyy better than the curry katsu since you don’t have to worry about the meat getting soggy and there’s more soup in this one for you to enjoy

What we did enjoy is when you spend over $40 you get a wooden utensil set, cup, or tote bag!
reviews.author: Cecilia Lee

reviews.text: Sanuki Udon is a cafeteria style Udon restaurant, similar to what you would see in a Japanese food court. The udon is assembled very quickly after you order and you can buy additional add-ons like pork katsu or a deep fried egg. I really enjoyed the udon’s texture and the flavor of the broth, but I found the add-ons to be not worth it. I tried the katsu and it was soggy and not seasoned. For the price of around $15 you get a decent sized bowl of udon, a nice place to sit and yap, and free hot tea.

reviews.text: Casual self served udon place. They make the udon in house and there's a window where you can see the chef making the noodles while you eat. I've been to...

I love this place.
They make everything (huge menu!) but would make you anything you want. Open late, great desserts. These folks care and they love their jobs. How refreshing is that??? Owner is usually here during the day. Nighttime guys are as hard working  as they are entertaining. Support the local pizza shop!!!

The lady at the register just looked at it and didn't say a word and then put it away and the guy heating up the pizza went to go play on his phone and then noticed it and gave it to me. I was sitting directly in front of the checkout the entire time. I don't know how you mess up such a simple operation but by the time I ate my pizza it was cold. And nobody wants to pay for cold pizza.

reviews.text: Decent Italian place.  Not much to say. It hits the spot but the ravioli I got was just alright. The tiramisu was really good though.

reviews.text:
Definitely coming back here. Every pasta dish we ordered was superb with the perfect amount of sauce and bouncy homemade pasta. Our waiter, Tony was the best. I couldn't choose between Mushroom or Bolognese sauce and he gave me half/half on my plate!!! Made my whole day especially as an indecisive person.
Seafood pasta was filled with a huge amount of seafood which made the price worth it.

The dessert was probably the highlight of our meal. We had panna cotta, tiramisu (best tiramisu i've had in my life), and zabaglione. Topped with fresh strawberries🤩🤩 Tony also gave us free extra dessert!!
reviews.author: Viona

reviews.text:
First time back in about 20 years and is exactly how I remembered.

Impeccable staff, great food, great ambience, and overall could not be happier with my meal and service.

It’s no reason this Trattoria has been around for over 100 years in the West village.

reviews.text: I had a reservation, was seated 30 minutes after my reservation time. Meanwhile people that arrived after us, got seated first. The food took an hour and 15 minutes to come out and when it was brought out, I was given the wrong dish. 10 minutes later my dish came out and was a tiny portion. The food was amazing and our server was apologetic but we still payed full price.

reviews.text: My husband and I dinned here while celebrating our anniversary on a trip to New York. It was the best food, and service, we had the whole trip! The waitress gave great recommendations and was so kind and personable too!

I enjoyed the Lasagna....

I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a great meal.

reviews.text: Showed up here on a Sunday night without reservations.  Was sat quickly and food was excellent.  The guy who was scheduled for the 10:00 set couldn't be there so a trio filled in.  I'm glad they did, music was superb!  Luca, our waiter, was one of the friendliest people we met during our trip and gave us plenty of inside tips about things to see and do.  Forget the more famous jazz places in the area, this is the spot to be.
reviews.author: A Martin

reviews.text: It is a really nice place. It was a great experience for us visiting NYC for a few days. We were lucky to find this restaurant in the basement of a busy corner. Small, but good to hear good jazz in a intimate manner. Good acoustic. Very efficient and friendly service. Two sets of good jazz for a very convenient cover. Clean and confortable. Would love to go again.

We got the beet salad, brie and Canadian bacon crostini, the carne lasagna flight, and...

reviews.text:
Craving lasagna, we searched Reddit and found La Lanterna, offering lasagna flights. Best of all, they were taking walk-ins on Friday night..

What an...
reviews.author: Michelle D.

reviews.text:
Came here to try the lasagna flights and they were awesome! We ordered one flight with meat and one without so we could try eight different types of lasagna in one meal! All were delicious, some simply outstanding.

We went on a Tuesday night in July and it was very quiet. We made reservations in advance but most tables were empty. We were sat in the enclosed back patio which is so charming and romantic but we were four adults and our cafe table was only big enough for maybe three of us. The two men at our table were laughing about how their legs were entwined so we all fit. It was also VERY dim in our little elevated corner of the patio area, again, romantic to a point, but when everyone has to lift the candle on the table like we are in the Renaissance to read the menu at all, maybe a little more light is warranted?

The menu is extensive so you are sure to find something to suit every taste although my daughter was surprised there weren’t any other pasta dishes save for the lasagna.

Our server John was warm and attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. I loved the history of the place and could feel the warmth of the woman who established La Lanterna in everything the restaurant offered.

We had two kinds of cheesecake and the Nutella “pizza” in addition to dinner and it was so good - especially dipped in coffee!

We were just tourists passing through, but thank you La Lanterna for making our last night in New York a happy - and delicious - experience.
reviews.author: Lisa E. (Peachy in Georgia)

reviews.text: The dim-lit ambience was exactly what I pictured it would be! When I made reservations I was hoping to get seated in the main enterance area because of the decoration and coziness combined with the fireplace, or the back area with the lanterns so I could get nice photos but ended up in the downstairs/basement. It wasn’t too bad just felt claustrophobic after a while it being a tight, crowded area. The food quality was great and had that homey touch to it, portions were exactly perfect for two people. Drinks were great and decently priced. Their desserts are defintely worth saving room for. Their extensive menu is one of the reasons I chose to dine here. Would reccommend!
reviews.author: Lavanya More

reviews.text: My partner and I had a great experience at this restaurant. Our only wish is that we had come earlier so we could sit at one of their outside tent tables. But we got there around midnight. We got the veggie lasagna flight and the mushroom one was so good that we had to order a full size on of it. I also would recommend the pesto lasagna so yummy.  The ambience is romantic, I like how it’s very dim lighting with little candles illuminating the table.
reviews.author: Ana

reviews.text: Great food and nice place, but the indoor patio was SO loud and the pizza sauce was watery. We ordered buffalo mozzarella and there wasn’t much on the pizza. The lasagna flight was good; I got the truffle on it but wished I didn’t because it somewhat overpowered the food. Would go back, but I would sit on the street in the private cabanas and not the back patio.
reviews.author: Tyler Pronesti

reviews.text: Came in for lunch on a weekday, where there was plenty of seating. The ambience in the outdoor seating area was nice. We both got the meat lasagna flight, and I thought it was very delicious. Every dish tasted distinctly different, and it made for a very enjoyable experience.

reviews.text: If you're not into protein, and you love a vegetable sandwich this is the place to go. I ordered the Italian and the meat was so paper thin you couldn't...

reviews.text: Happened upon this place and it was perfect. Drinks were delicious (I had an Agave Cooler - Mezcal lime ginger and cucumber, husband had a Galiano cooler which was perfect on a hot summer day). So many good cocktails to choose from. Located on a quiet street so sitting outside was a pleasure. Bistro burger was amazing - cooked perfectly and so good. Would come back again in a heartbeat! Menu had many good bar options. Staff was friendly and helpful. Unpretentious. Would recommend for sure!
reviews.author: jamie korelitz

reviews.text: While the gas is out, the limited menu and cozy vibes are still very strong and any martinis in this area in 2024 under $20 is something to celebrate.
reviews.author: Peter Smithy

reviews.text:
Beautiful spot in NYC with good service.
The food was good, I tried 6 different dishes including dessert, food was cooked properly, a sign of a skilled chef, I enjoyed all of the dishes but in terms of how good the dishes were, they were good but not good enough or creative enough to be memorable or to make me come back again, French cuisine is complex and I'm judging this restaurant by those standards.
Dessert wasn't bad but also wasn't satisfying. I tried two dishes from the menu and non of them made me go for a second or third spoon.
The most disappointing part is the wine menu, I tried all the whites and all the reds by the glass, and non of the listed wines do justice to Burgundy or Bordeaux or French wine in general, and also they do not pair well with the food served, yes they mentioned that they are working on their wine menu but for a French cuisine they can do much better than this, I also tried one of their cocktails and mentioned that I don't want it to be overly sweet, they adjusted the ingredients and added so much ginger that I only tasted ginger in the drink.
Friendly staff and I hope that they look into these minor details, such a beautiful spot needs more attention and creativity
I don't know how this restaurant was before the pandemic, I'm only reviewing it by my recent experience.
reviews.author: Ahmed Alshaiba

reviews.text: Absolutely delicious French food in a European atmosphere.  The menu changes everyday based which add a unique sophistication.  The bread and butter was so fresh and reminded me of Le Chateaubriand in Paris.  Enjoyed every bite of the asparagus and crudo and the steak and fish were cooked to perfection.  The only knock is the portions are so small and we ended up getting a slice at Bleeker Street Pizza.
reviews.author: Andrew Davis

reviews.text: We actually wanna try something else but we found out they change menu regularly. So we tried the asparagus and skate wing which are pretty good. One thing about the menu is that the options are quite limited so we didn't get as much food as we want.

reviews.text: I wish I could leave a negative star review. The guy in the window was ridiculously RUDE. It began to drizzle so we decided to stop in for a cocktail to...

reviews.text: Read this. NA Slice is the best. THE BEST. The best pizza in the city. I can’t stress it enough. You won’t have anything like it anywhere else. The ingredients are fresh from Italy (as stated on the wall) and it is so unbelievably fresh. I’ve only been coming in for about a month since I found it near school and now I come whenever I am having a bad day. Truly, delicious pizza. I say this as somebody who used to make pizza as a job. My only complaint is that it’s not open 24/7 so I can come in the middle of the night for my fix. Older folks, I’m not exaggerating and younger folks, I’m not glazing. It really is just great. And the owner is humble and nice, he will stop and talk to you if you want (given it’s not busy). Don’t know what to try? Just get a plain slice, that will tell you enough…enjoy
reviews.author: Jason Kael

reviews.text:
pizza made from flour brought from Italy. This kind of dough is rarely found in Manhattan. perfectly baked. crispy and moderately soft. Great tomatoes and great cheese!
you find yourself in the homely atmosphere of great friends.
the price is more than friendly!
This is a small island of comfort and cleanliness
reviews.author: Лора Биджис.

reviews.text: Stumbled upon this Neapolitan pizza gem near NYU campus and was pleasantly surprised! The pizza had a crispy exterior yet maintained a fluffy, warm texture inside, making each bite so worth it ❤️. With a variety of toppings like burrata and prosciutto, along with tempting pasta options (lasagna!!), this place exceeded my expectations. Definitely worth a visit for a satisfying Italian meal! If I were a student at New York University I’d want to come here every day for lunch 💕

reviews.text:
Ordered here for a quick bite, the pizzas here upon first inspection are thicker and have kinda weirdly melted cheese, the kinda cheese you see melted on a 1.50 slice. (btw this was NOT 1.50). The server was very nice and attentive! however the pizza was quite bad. the crust was good and very thick yet in some parts almost moist/raw. The cheese and tomato sauce tasted as weirdly as i hoped it wouldnt, Tastes of low quality preparation. The pepperoni itself tasted amazing but everything else was below average.
UPDATE: Yes My opinion is different from other people here because I myself am a different person, and to be clear, on Yelp, I am the average response to your business. Just because your ingredients are top notch, does not mean your production/Outcome will be aswell. Thank you

The presentation was just as nice…all the food and drinks came on these wooden platters which you pick up at the counter. This is my new go to place!

reviews.text: Such a clean and beautiful spot. Lunch special was a great deal and was absolutely delicious. Will definitely be recommending this place to friends!

The place was very expensive
The meat was very hard and chewy
The hamburger was dry
The fries were good but that was the best thing in that place
They give you the check with 18% tip included (after none of them noticed us, and the place was empty)

The day after me and my friend had food poisoning. (It was the only meal we had that day because of nausea) It was a bad experience.
I will never return.

The picture looks good but it is just the looks
reviews.author: יובל מלכי

reviews.text: Joel was absolutely incredible and turned my dining experience into something truly special. From the moment we sat down, he went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect. His warm smile and friendly demeanor immediately put us at ease, and his attention to detail was unmatched. Joel anticipated our needs before we even had to ask, offered thoughtful recommendations from the menu, and genuinely cared about our enjoyment. It’s rare to find someone who takes such pride in their work, but Joel clearly loves what he does, and it shows. He transformed a regular night out into an unforgettable experience. Joel is a true gem, and I can’t wait to return because of him!
reviews.author: Jeremy Weiss

reviews.text: The food is 10/10 and so is the service. I’m definitely coming back to this place. Joel was an amazing waiter

reviews.text: Today we tried this place, and despite the high prices, it was surprising that they didn't even provide fries. After ordering, the burgers were quite large and tasty, but the fries were swimming in oil and tasted awful, making them inedible. It was a disgrace to even serve them like that. When we informed the waiter about it, instead of offering an alternative, they just walked away without saying anything. When we asked for the bill, they included the two uneaten fries as well, along with a mandatory tip. This behavior is simply unacceptable, and for this reason, I will never return to this place again. Additionally, the service was poor, and the sitting area was very messy and smelled.
reviews.author: Ekin Alp

reviews.text: Loved this bacon burger! 😋 would have liked the bun to be a little fluffier and toastier. The sauces there are always great. Also, HIGHLY recommend the sweet potato friessss. What brings this rating down is simply the prices. For the same prices you can get more upscale, better quality food at other kosher restaurants. The portions they give do not match what they charge, but the food is always good.

The food was good a bit pricy. Had the regular burger, grilled chicken w/salad and sweet potato fries. 

Burger and chicken were good, the fries excellent....

reviews.text:
Came here with hopes with picking up an order 

I approached the hostess and told her I was picking up

She told me to head to the bar

I head to the bar...
reviews.author: Henry T.

reviews.text:
One of my favorite spots for drinks+food in NYC! I truly mean it! Their food and drinks are both great, especially if you enjoy a touch of Japanese influence though out.

I have visited here many times. I came with my girlfriends for drinks and with my husband for dinners, and I always had wonderful time. Their cocktails were fantastic as well as their Japanese imports. The food were consistently tasty. I highly recommend their Caesar Salad、Omu Rice(both the chicken and garlic were good) and the Duck Roast.

The atmosphere is chill and classy, reminiscent of the old school westernized Japanese restaurants you’d actually find in Japan. I will keep coming back for sure!
reviews.author: CY KT

reviews.text:
Really enjoyed our visit for some afternoon cocktails. Will def be coming back for the flavorful, well balanced, elegantly decorated cocktails and want to try their food next time!

Their attention to detail is top notch, from the diff. coasters to use based on the cocktails glasses & presentation, to the attentive yet never too much service we received. We were very thankful towards our hostess and bartender for the great experience we had.

We tried 3 cocktails in total, 2 from the menu and one creation. Our bartender Daiki really gave lots of thoughts to what he presented us, and the result was fantastic! The other two we tried were Bee-Bop and Fly me to the moon, we really liked the Japanese touch presented in both drinks, well balanced with a hint of saltiness! Already looking forward to our next visit!
reviews.author: Maya S

reviews.text:
Great vibes, great bites, and even greater drinks!

Food: we ordered the Kani Cream Croquettes, Signature Omurice, and Katsu Sando.

The croquettes were incredibly creamy under the light crunch of the breading and the tartar sauce that comes with it was the perfect dip.

The omelette in the omurice was cooked to perfection and the demiglace sauce had a fantastic depth of flavor.

The pork in the Katsu Sando had probably the juiciest piece of pork I've had in a long time.

On the drinks side we had The Moga, Fly Me To The Moon, Princesses Mononoke, Bee-bop, and the New York Henge. All were fantastic in their own way. This bar has a great selection of Japanese whiskeys so I highly recommend the cocktails that feature whiskey or going for the whiskey flight.
reviews.author: Jaye

reviews.text:
For an elevated Japanese cocktail bar with bites, this is the spot. Bar Moga is a great place to come with friends or a date. The vibes are great, place is cozy.

The drinks are strong and very tasty. The food was great. The potato salad is a must try, the crab croquette was also nice a fluffy and smooth. The pork sando was juicy and cooked to perfection. And the omnirice wasn’t too salty and full of flavor.

Bathroom was clean, staff friendly. Note this place does have a 2 hr dining limit.
reviews.author: Benjamin L

reviews.text:
Bar Moga is a divey and nostalgic Japanese restaurant/cocktail bar in Greenwich Village. We came here for the signature omurice, but I was more impressed by the mocktail.

My friend described this spot giving Haruki Murakami novel vibes, which I totally agreed. If you are looking for a place for a romantic date night, Bar Moga will surely impress your date.

＊Potato Salad
It is more like a one-person serving with the small portion. The potato salad was blended with mashed potato, carrots and onions. The mustard dressing has a sweet honey taste. We liked the crispy lotus garnished on top.

＊Gokden Uni Pan
A tiny and delicate piece of uni shokupan, topped with hokkaido uni. Not a big fan of uni, but this was not fishy at all. Very buttery and creamy.

＊Omu Rice**
We opted for the classic chicken omurice with chicken. Our server cut open the omelette for us, and gently pour the hot demi-glaze sauce over the egg. The omelette was cooked to perfection — runny, fluffy and soft. So delectable with the tasty fried rice and veal sauce.

＊Amber Sky (zero proof cocktail)**
Flavor notes: Lyre's Italian spritz, orange, grapefruit, lemon, rose, honey and aquafaba. As a non-alcoholic girlie, I’ve tried quite many mocktails. This is by far the most satisfying one I’ve ever had. The rosy flavor shines, and I liked the fruity combo of orange and grapefruit. It was nicely crafted with a foamy texture.

***Get mentally prepared their food portion is VERY SMALL for the steep price you’re paying.

The food is good and we just waitedfor 15mins on Friday night and got a table

cocktail is hmmm but looks good

reviews.text: Everything exceeded my expectations! Went on a Wednesday night. Service was top notch, everything we ordered was really enjoyable, and the atmosphere was cool. Overall a fun and luxurious vibe. Definitely recommend the French Dip and Tagliatelle Bolognese.

reviews.text: I celebrated my birthday here and everything was perfection. The atmosphere is so fun yet the food is absolutely incredible. It’s very rare in New York City to be able to find a restaurant that can perfect both food and vibe. The dirty jeans might also be my favorite martini in the world.

reviews.text: Went here with some friends in June! I thought it would be just another overhyped hotspot but I was pleasantly surprised! The vibe was great. Not too crowded but still a good amount of people. They were starting a new menu too and we basically tried everything. My favorites were the steak tartare, the tuna carpaccio, the cocktail shrimp, and the roast chicken! Plus don’t skip the cookie for dessert. The club downstairs is really fun too!
reviews.author: Isadora Lillian

reviews.text: I come here regularly when I’m in New York. The seasonal offerings from their farm in New Hope are amazing, everything on the core menu is awesome, and the chicken is consistently, outrageously delicious. Don’t sleep on this place.
reviews.author: Devin Foley

reviews.text: My family and I came in from Detroit and Boston respectively. We were fortunate enough to celebrate a birthday at Jean's. We enjoyed the dressed Gaia oysters, Farm Crudite(from their own farm)  served raw bar style(clever) with a tahini flavored dipping sauce, we loved the lobster rolls lobster bisque shots and beef tartare. The Pomodoro pasta is certainly not to be missed(devoured later) a long with the burger with house made cheddar sauce. But the real standout for us all was the Roasted Chicken. Just comfort and love on a plate. The flavors we fresh, crisp, and bold. But  the plates were light and easy to share. The chocolate chip cookie is also a standout for a reason. It was delicious and the bourbon milk it's served with makes the perfect pairing. We had the pleasure of having Mirce assit us for the evening and he was a pleasure. The entire team was awesome! We had the fortune of meeting Frankie, who is a true professional and delight!

reviews.text: This place was cute and I think three stars is appropriate... They're trying to pull off New York City posh, which is OK but the food has a ways to go....

Our server was sweet and knowledgeable as well, but there was a bit of miscommunication about our cheese tray. She said she would bring us the list of cheeses so we could choose, but she didn't come back for a while and then when we asked her about it, she said that the order is already in, so we didn't get to choose. It still tasted really good though so not too upset about that.
reviews.author: Ria S.

reviews.text:
Nice wine bar. Staff did not want to engage in recommending specific things.
It’s a perfectly fine place to go to for a drink - nothing more, nothing less

reviews.text: I reserved the back area of the underground bar for my birthday and it was perfect. By the time we arrived, the owner himself welcomed us and helped us with our initial wine selection. As our guests arrived throughout the night, the bartenders made sure everyone had a wine glass and that no glass was ever empty. We were so impressed by the service and how accommodating the whole staff was. And of course the wine itself was great as well. Definitely recommend this place for celebrating a special event or even coming to casually enjoy affordable wine!

reviews.text: We’re with my son on his make a wish trip.  We have been all over the city and he’s had a hard time connecting with places/restaurants/activities for various reasons. We just happened to come here and it honestly made his day SO much brighter.  Oscar was our main waiter and there was another gentleman who helped us as well.  Their attitude along with the food and atmosphere made my son so comfortable and he was just thrilled. If I could give more than 5 stars I would. Absolutely outstanding. These men deserve the world for what they did for my son who is struggling health wise and the emotions that come with that. THANK YOU

reviews.text: Denino's Pizzeria Tavern in NYC offers a delightful culinary experience with its mouthwatering pizzas and welcoming ambiance. The crispy yet chewy crust complements the rich, flavorful toppings, creating a perfect harmony of taste. The attentive staff and cozy atmosphere make it an ideal spot for a casual meal or a gathering with friends. Especially Tugba was so helpful and friendly. Denino's commitment to quality ingredients and classic recipes ensures a memorable dining experience, making it a must-visit for pizza enthusiasts in the city.
reviews.author: Volkan Kirimlioglu

reviews.text: Extremely authentic Italian food. Great atmosphere and great food. Mozzarella sticks were crispy while the cheese inside was soft. The Italian egg rolls were full of pork flavor and the balsamic glaze was the cherry on top. The pizza was fantastic. We got buffalo chicken, margarita, prosciutto, and vodka. The dough was crisp and had the best flavor of any pizza I had in awhile. Definitely go here
reviews.author: A. Nelson

reviews.text:
I wish I could give this place 10 stars. I had their pizza for the first time 6 months ago, on my first visit to NYC. On my next visit a month ago, I tried several other places, thinking that someone else HAD to be able to have a pizza as good as theirs. I went home disappointed, and dreaming of Denino’s. Then this week, I legit flew to NYC from Oregon for 36 hours JUST so I could get their pizza again. It was absolutely worth it, and I’d do it again!

On this past visit, we accidentally ordered the wrong style of pizza. It was our fault 100%, and we took full responsibility for our error and asked them to bring us a second pie. Despite it being fully on us, they insisted on comping the second pizza and wouldn’t hear of letting us pay for it. This would still be a 5-star review if they hadn’t comped it, but the professionalism and passion for their customers’ satisfaction is what makes me wish I could double the stars given. When you eat at Denino’s, it’s the real deal, in all ways. This will forever be the pizza to beat for me, and I would be shocked if any other place comes close to challenge. I cannot wait to go back!
reviews.author: Kacie427

reviews.text:
Hearty and delicious  pizza with unique combinations.

The service was slow. There were only two employees on the floor. Once we got our order in the wait wasn’t too long for food. There were just too many customers to employees which slowed things down.

Atmosphere was great, tables were sticky, but everything else was great!

Very solid 4/5 from me!

reviews.text:
Bareburger is a cute spot I came in for a pickup order and desperately had to use the bathroom I went to the restroom first since that's a really nice about it something unique for the area. When I got back staff gave me it's ample time to look at the menu and ask questions based on the guy I talked to whose team trustworthy enough the portions are ample and the food is consistently good . After I ordered the chicken bites and fries ( bit pricey like everything on the menu but the quality was really good so I can't complain) the guy at the counter invited me to sit at the bar and even gave me a big pitcher with water and a cup. At first I thought maybe he sees how sweaty I am on this hot day and knew I needed it (as I drank the whole thing). But in talking to him he said that the heat was pretty unbearable and wished that everyone could get a nice pitcher and a glass. Cool guy and extremly friendly for a takeout order.

What are the restaurant has a lot of indoor seating there are a few parks nearby or anyone can sit and eat in relative peace. Thinking about the meal I had on on that hot summer day is making me hungry. Do yourself a favor and stop at Bareburger its worth the price.

reviews.text:
What began as a casual New England-inspired fish shack in Manhattan’s East Village has evolved into a stylish American seafood brasserie, known for its warm hospitality and bold, seasonally inspired dishes.

Walking into The Mermaid Oyster Bar  feels like a mini escape into an inviting ambiance that is warm, relaxed, yet refined. The menu, featuring classic seafood dishes with inventive twists, reflects the freshest seasonal ingredients. Whether you’re savoring oysters from the raw bar or diving into a lobster roll, each dish captures the essence of seaside dining with a touch of New York sophistication.

We stopped by for Happy Hour, which runs from 4pm to 6pm. We ordered the shrimp and avocado sliders, fish tacos, clam chowder, and lobster Mac and Cheese. Everything was absolutely delicious. At the end of the meal came complementary chocolate dessert which was a much appreciated gesture.

Every detail, from the food, to the attentive service, and the decor, has been thoughtfully crafted to create a comfortable and memorable dining experience. For anyone seeking a taste of the coast in the heart of the city, Mermaid Oyster Bar offers a refreshing, laid-back retreat.
reviews.author: Debbie DelValle

reviews.text: I was so sad when Mermaid Inn closed in the east village but am so happy to see this one open!  First they have a great happy hour food and drinks weekly and on a weekend! This restaurant is modern chic.  I just thought the actual bar could have been little bigger.  The host, bartenders, servers and the manager were all super awesome! The drinks and food so good! I’ll be making this spot my regular spot!

reviews.text: Cool atmosphere with great service. Tried multiple items on the menu and all were delicious. Lobster Roll was my favorite along with the shrimp and avocado slider!

tuna crudo, oysters, branzino and their table bread were fantastic, everything had great flavor profile.

reviews.text: I just bought a cup of coffee here this morning.   Upon tasting it at the counter (to decide if I wanted milk or not, depending on the roast type) I discovered it was luke warm.  The counter guy offered to steam it for me, thinking on his feet.  However, turns out he had a fresh pot of coffee that he used to top up my coffee later.  Come, quality control guys - don't serve a suboptimal product when you've got a better one in the queue behind it. I'm stuck with a watery coffee with a frothy top (!).  Can't trust these guys anymore ...

This pizza:  CAVOLFIORE AL TAGLIO: cauliflower, gruyere cheese, parsley and breadcrumbs, was very good, and a mushroom pizza slice: FUNGHI AL TAGLIO - cremini mushrooms, onions, thyme, sea salt (Vegan), was even better, and a reasonably priced $4 by NY standards.  They are also flexible to allow you to take out your selections in your own bags/containers to be eco and save in packaging hassle and waste.

reviews.text: Masala Times is an absolute gem for anyone who loves flavorful food, a lively atmosphere, and great prices. The restaurant offers an extensive menu with delicious options for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians. The rich and authentic flavors in every dish truly capture the essence of Indian street food. The ambience is vibrant and upbeat, with Bollywood music playing in the background, adding a nostalgic and fun touch to the experience. Whether you’re craving a quick bite or a relaxed meal with friends, Masala Times delivers on taste, atmosphere, and value. Highly recommended!

reviews.text:
it’s amazing that you can choose how your batter is done here! I chose original batter but it was crispy enough, wondering how extra crispy would be like!
The soy garlic and sweet&spicy flavors are classic! Savory, garlicky, slightly sweet, with a bit of tanginess… the flavor combination is just additive! I can devour more fried chicken just for the sauce! Honey garlic sauce was also incredible. The pungency brought by vinegar was so delightful, sharpened my appetite immediately.
Don’t skip their appetizers and sandwiches! The cheeseballs were airy and rich with cheesy goodness. The monster cheese chicken sandwich came with melting cheese! I can’t go back to the cold, insipid slice of deli cheese now.

reviews.text: DO NOT GO TO THIS LOCATION. I would give negative stars. This is by far the worst fast food, actually any establishment, I’ve ever been to. I have made the mistake of going there 3x (will never again, and you shouldn’t try it 1x). I love Wendy’s, and this location is a disgrace to their name. Seating is FILTHY, the soda machine is always broken, and worst of all the staff…oh the staff… they are unbelievably rude. They will mess your order up and act like it’s your fault and a huge inconvenience to…idk out the fries in the bag. The wont do anything to fix it unless you have 20m to spare. I’ve seen multiple customers finally lose it and start yelling at the staff to fix their order after being blown off multiple times. I probably should’ve tried that too, in hindsight. The staff has no shame, no morals, and no shred of respect to the customer. I have never come across an attitude like this at any store, and it was all 3 times I went. The owner needs to fire the manager + some of the staff, and retrain the rest of the staff asap on how to make the food properly, and speak to customers in a respectful way. The staffs parents also need to retract their grown kids how to treat other people with respect. If the owner knows how awful this place is, the regional manager should step in, as it is so far from Wendy’s standards, that it should be shut down. -5 out of 5 stars.

A hidden treasure in Noho surrounded by many other Italian restaurants but this one stands out. The Gnocchi of the day, with oxtail ricotta and truffle oil may be my favorite pasta dish of the year.

Prices also quite reasonable here. Come with friends, get the burrata, the artichokes, the cotaletta and a bunch of pastas. Cocktail menu was ok but mostly lacking, though there was a great wine program to balance it.

reviews.author: Albert Law

reviews.text:
An evening at Misirizzi has the singular ability to both dislocate and ground you so completely you forget about time. Each room has a different feeling, inviting you to truly begin to use your senses from the doorstep. This is before you get to any other humans and any of the food. Let’s start with the humans: I was greeted warmly & quickly by the owners. While this isn’t a classic red sauce joint (which I love as a native New Yorker), it retains a family feel. The restaurant is named after an indomitable toy and you certainly feel that strength of spirit when you are greeted. We were then assisted by the gracious Gloria, who has that enviable combination of elegance, effervescence, and know-how. She walked us through the menu, taking note of dietary concerns and preferences. Every bit of the menu has a story that’s connected to a place and time yet forward-facing. I had a traditional pasta with some adjustments that took me straight to heaven. I’m going to skip ahead to dessert because, simply put, I had so much FUN. It took me back to making cannoli as a little girl, again returning to the theme of play. You are able to fill your own cannoli (and if you are so embarrassingly inclined, have the cream… potentially straight from the bag). Usually I dislike a DIY moment when I’m all dolled up, but this was pure pleasure. After dinner, espresso (corrected) topped off the evening. I can’t wait to return. Thank you to the team and a special shoutout to Gloria!

Tl;dr Misirizzi gives you something you can feel. In a crowded market, it stands out as somewhere you can reconnect with yourself and your loved ones.
reviews.author: Keylee S

reviews.text:
What a great Italian dinner at Misirizzi. I visited on a Friday night, it was pretty busy. Very nice and cozy vibe. I tried a few pasta dishes including strozzapreti, lasagne, carbonara, zucchini parmigiana. I absolutely loved the fried artchokes (appetizer)

Everything accompigned by Passerina, a delicious Italian white wine.

reviews.text:
We came here for a chill spot to sit outside with after walking around all day -> and Tim and team were awesome!

We ended up staying for the $6 happy hour (4-6pm, Sun-Fri) -> wings, burger, mahi mahi tacos, nachos, and drinks. I don’t know why this place isn’t constantly packed because everything was great!

I had Moscow mules, hubby had beers. The buffalo wings (nice and spicy), burger (great beef) and nachos (huge plate) were perfectly done and came out quickly.

Plus - the people who walk by this place are all characters. They’ve got fans to blow on you outside too! It’s also got a great vibe inside and they play a mix of music that keeps you singing along.

This is a neighborhood gem and it’s worth stopping in for (happy hour or not) 🙌🏻🙏🏼

Extra points for eco friendly straws 💫

I ordered an iced taro latte and the lemon poppyseed waffle. The taro latte was on the sweeter side, but I still enjoyed it. The waffle was fun to eat, with the cream and strawberries. It was pretty filling too.

Unfortunately the bathroom was out of service while we were there, but the rest of our experience was great! The servers were friendly and attentive (almost too attentive though, with two different employees asking if we were ready to order within minutes of each other).

reviews.text: Really nice inside, but food was not the best. I came to this place because I have heard wonderful reviews and wanted to try it out for myself. First problem was paying $17.50 for a deli sandwich. I opted for the B+C which has chorizo and egg and it left me feeling disgusting. Chorizo here was not as good as what I have had at other places. My friend got the Cubano and that was a little bit better, but for the price, size, and taste we would have been better somewhere else. I understand the prime location and cute inside may raise prices, but this place is not worth it and quite overrated.
reviews.author: Zoe Scourtes

reviews.text: We called on Black friday to ask if the restaurant was open and were rudely told that it was indeed open until 4PM… Many people told me that they were extremely rude and always trying to close early so we went there directly, maybe a 45 minutes walk. When we got there at 1PM, we were told that they were closing early because they were not making enough money… we said that we just called and they decided to let us order. As we were leaving the place, another customer complained that they took the time to call before coming in and asked to be able to order. Yes their sandwiches are really amazing, tasteful but they clearly are overpriced and the staff probably has the worst customer service ever. How can you tell customers to come by on the phone and decide to close 3 hours early…

You heard right, the burger is excellent here.
The steak tartare and the tuna were solid as well.

reviews.text: I’ve always passed by and I keep telling myself that I’m gonna give this place a try and it did not disappoint! 1st of all the hostess are so welcoming, we sat at the bar and Ms. Ashley hands down took care of us she was amazing and was very hospitable. If the food wasn’t good I would still come back to be served by her but that wasn’t the case the food was great too. They have a huge selection of wine we ordered the spring pea pasta it was refreshing and delicious, we ordered the steak as well which is pack with flavor. Ashley had good recommendations! We had the chocolate cake for dessert which is rich not too sweet which was to my liking! This place is definitely worth checking out

reviews.text: we went to claudette for a lovely saturday brunch. we sat on the patio and it was perfect. we got the cashew salad, french toast and the shakshuka. everything incredible and the service was great. the browned butter that came with the brioche french toast really elevated the experience. the shakshuka was phenomenal. add to the list for brunch and dinner.

reviews.text: The Mediterranean decor is the biggest draw to this restaurant. It is soothingly light and airy. Service is friendly and the food is good enough....

reviews.text: I would give a 10 star if I could. The taste of the food was very simple, yet amazingly gooood!! So fresh and tasty. We got their meatballs, garlic bread, croissants, and pistachio coffee and all were great!!
reviews.author: Armin Rad

reviews.text:
I love coming to Panineria for a quick and easy lunch. The staff is friendly, the service is fast, and the food is consistently tasty.

For sandwiches, I always get the baguette (+$1) over the ciabatta. It’s thin, so you won’t be overstuffed by the bread. And it’s crispy, but but not the kind of crispy that will injure your mouth. I appreciate that they put a reasonable amount of meat, veg, and cheese in the sandwiches too. I am far more impressed by a balanced sandwich than a monstrous one.

The lentil soup was earthy, hearty, and mild. Sharing a soup and sandwich between two people was the perfect amount of food.

They used to have spray bottles of balsamic on the tables to spray on the sandwiches. I didn’t see them this visit and I hope they bring them back!
reviews.author: Kana Higuchi

reviews.text: The service at this place was absolutely amazing! So friendly, so helpful, & great recommendations! The food tasted delicious! The atmosphere is relaxing and so cozy! Will definitely be back! Thank you!
reviews.author: Sutton Glazner

reviews.text: Delicious sandwich on roasted tomato focaccia. Out of all the places I’ve tried many Italian sandwiches in NY this trip and so far this is my favorite. I definitely am heading back here before leaving. The staff is super friendly and definitely add to the authenticity of the restaurant. Come visit if you’re in the area!
reviews.author: Rebekah Brown

reviews.text: Very cute, small italian spot. The burrata arabiatta pasta was tasty and spicy! The caesar salad was also really great. I’d come back for sure!

reviews.text:
The food was good but nothing impressive/special. We did the wine pairing which was a huge mistake, it didn't go with the food at all. Honestly we should have known the wine pairing wouldn't be good since the chef changes the menu each day based on what's fresh (hence it'd be difficult to get the most optimal pairing). The servers also didn't know anything about the wine.

Overall, the food is fine but not good enough/unique enough to justify the price.
reviews.author: Yuchen L

reviews.text:
Overall, the entire experience was more on the disappointing side. This is not our first time dining at a "locally sourced ingredients" establishment or a Michelin-starred place. We also tried not to leave any food uneaten, knowing that the products were locally sourced, but this does not reflect our thoughts on the dishes.

The meal started on a fun note with different types of cucumbers paired with a green dip that was quite delicious. However, from that point onward, the main course was disappointing, despite the theme of the lunch being French brasserie.

The salad and ratatouille were nice, but the mussel dish tasted bitter due to the sauce, and the steak and potato plate was quite dry and rubbery. I've had similar dishes many times before, so it wasn't an issue of trying them for the first time.

As for the dessert, it was a large donut with apricot filling. It was served without any utensil to cut it, which might have been fine. However, the donut itself seemed to have been sitting out for a while—the bread tasted oily, and the filling inside was unfortunately quite sour. Even my partner, who usually enjoys all types of desserts, did not enjoy this one.

Lastly, regarding the service, everyone was friendly, but given that it was a menu-less place, we would have appreciated some explanation about the dishes without having to ask about each one.

We are not sure if we'd like to return to this place, although we might give it another chance since the menu changes seasonally. However, it's a big maybe for now.
reviews.author: Bonnie

reviews.text: Truly exceptional, but didn’t we know that already? They customized vegetarian meals for me and dad while my partner ate the freshest fish and meats to his hearts desire. They truly know how to make ingredients sing. We also had the wine pairing and I don’t know when I’ll have wine like that again- nothing hits the same anymore. Can’t wait to make a trip update to the farm one day
reviews.author: Kavya Rajesh

reviews.text:
• Blue Hill in Manhattan is a wonderful place that I'd love to visit again.
• Their farm-to-table concept is simply amazing. They started with a restaurant in upstate New York and now have one in NYC too.
• What I really liked is that their veggies are grown on their own farm, and the meats and fish are provided by their partners. You can taste the fresh difference!
• The interior has a simple yet classy vibe, with lovely flowers adorning the space.
• The food is served as a mix of different dishes in a four-course tasting menu.
• They did an excellent job accommodating my dislikes and allergy requests.
• The staff is incredibly attentive and friendly.
reviews.author: Mariya R

reviews.text: Fantastic meal! All the ingredients were sooo fresh you could tell they grew it instead of sourcing like other restaurants. Especially in peak of summer, the vegetables and berries were so sweet and clearly vine ripened. Going to start coming often for date night!
