reviews.text: By far, one of the best diners in NYC!! Diners are not a place to order pasta and expect it to be good but I think this place is an exception. I ordered penne alla vodka and it was on par with a good Italian restaurant. Unbelievable! I married into an Italian family so I know my pastas. They are a bit pricey but for the amount of food you get, it's justified! We got the leftovers to go. Definitely going to come back here again to try other items on the menu. Also, one of fastest service that I have seen! A big thumbs up to them!!

The pizza man was very friendly and this is one of the best options if you want a classic NY slice.

Fast service, freshly made pizza they toss in the oven immediately after you order, veggie pizza was smothered in toppings, and was all extremely good. They do need to update their online pricing.

Very old school/ antique pizza parlor vibe.  No recycling bin here. I am always disappointed when restaurants don't recycle.

I came in to watch some college football the other day and ordered some chipotle bbq wings and fried pickles. The wings were delicious and they have 8 flavors to choose from. Fried pickles were amazing too. They have plenty of TVs and a bunch of local beer on tap. There’s an upstairs as well so plenty of room for games and late night dancing.

Visited this place for the first time with my friends and my gosh we had such a fun experience! The staff was incredible. We were a big group and sat upstairs and the bartender up there was just the nicest guy and incredibly fun. The food offered here is amazing!! The best thing on the menu in my opinion was the empanadas (chicken was my favorite) and the tater tots!!
Just an overall amazing experience and will definitely be coming back here again!

reviews.text: We are huge fans of Loring Place, and we were stoked to get have more pizza options from Dan Kluger - this time available for delivery! Unfortunately, the delivery system has some major kinks to sort out. We ordered at 5:15 and were given a 6:00 delivery estimate. The pizzas actually arrived just after 7:15, by which point they were cold and soggy. Compared to the pizzas at Loring Place - which are incredible - these were decidedly average in terms of ingredients and preparation. I am not hating on either cold or average pizza; but given the cachet attached to the operation and the price point, these needed to be better.

I dig Georgian cuisine so much.

I had my favorite dish khachapuri, I wish that I could finish the entire plate, I was simply too full. I was obsessed with this food the very first time I had it in DC, it’s rare to spot it on the menu in most restaurants.
Plus, I drank a Georgian pear soda.

reviews.text:
The night I came here, I was surprisingly not in the mood for pho, but rather a noodle dish without any broth. So I tried an item from their menu, in the "Hello Saigon Special Menu" category. It was the "dry" noodles with boneless short rib, paired with the lemongrass sauce option.

To put it succinctly, I'm a child of immigrants from Southeast Asia, and grew up eating very authentic cuisine from that region, and I can confidently say that the rich, in-depth Vietnamese flavors in the noodle dish I had were equal, if not better than, something my mom would have cooked in my childhood. I will be a repeat customer.
reviews.author: Alex Pok

reviews.text: Simply a scrumptious banh mi, one of the best I’ve had. The bread was still fluffy and fresh a bit past midday, and my expectation of a slightly dry sandwich was decidedly disproved. Decent value for the large size of the sandwich; I paid $12.50 in mid September 2024 for the special ham banh mi.

reviews.text: CARBONE was great. We went for lunch and it was amazing. We started with the beets which I strongly recommend. We then had the mushroom linguini, spicy rigatoni, and meatballs. Everything was so good. All of the servers were on point as well.

reviews.text: Carbone is an exceptional culinary establishment. The dining experience begins with a delightful assortment of bread accompanied by mozzarella and salami, setting the stage for a memorable meal. The menu boasts a delectable array of dishes, including the tantalizing spicy vodka rigatoni, succulent meatballs, flavorful veal parmigiana, and a heavenly cheesecake. The service provided at Carbone is exemplary, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable dining experience. The ambiance of the restaurant is meticulously curated, creating the perfect atmosphere for a refined culinary journey. I highly recommend Carbone for an extraordinary dining experience.

Went because online on google it says theres udon on the menu - this however isnt true. Options consist of wavy thin ramen and some appetizers as well as rice meal options.

Honestly though, im not mad. I was quite impressed with how flavorful the broth was and the meat was super tender and tasty too. The ramen came out fast and the service was good. Overall, it was really delicious and I’ll definitely be coming back.

reviews.text:
A small ramen restaurant with not so many seats. We visited on Sunday noon, and it’s pretty empty.
The restaurant is specialized with spicy noodles. My husband tried mild and I had the pork done soup with level 2 spicy. Level 2 is not spicy at all to me. The soup is rich, and the noodles are on the thin side.
The only thing I don’t like is the meat in the noodles. It is very fatty and tastes a bit cold inside. I cannot eat second bite.
We also ordered the appetizer sampler, I like the fired dumplings and fried chicken a lot.

reviews.author: Ryan Z.

reviews.text:
ThisBowl is like a boujee Sweetgreen. I can't even believe those words are leaving my lips, but here we are.

I wanted something clean and healthy after a mediocre workout, and had been recommended this place by a few trusted sources. I walked up at 7:52pm and was shocked when I was met with a line out the door. I was even more shocked when I opened the door and felt like I had just entered a wormhole to Beverly Hills.

It felt like a designer clothing store more than a restaurant: House music thumping, expensive art on the walls, and beautiful people draped in Artizia Puffers, Dover Street Market Hoodies, Arcteryx Beanies, baggy jeans paired with Jordan 4s, etc. Like who are y'all in here trying to see lmao.

I, in my zip up Kirkland hoodie, got to the front and ordered the Braised Beef bowl ($17) which consisted of braised beef, kale, cucumber, sweet potato, red onion, tamari ponzu, wasabi mayo drizzle, and umami nut crunch. It's sad that $17 is essentially the market price for a good fast casual bowl these days, but such is life. It's an evil world we live in.

I'm beast so I opted for double protein, but felt like I took a spinning back kick to the ribs from Jon Jones when it rang up for an extra $8. I should have told them to cancel it, but I'm really shy and insecure so I tapped that apple pay like the good little boy I am. $8 for some extra beef is NASTY WORK.

In fairness, this bowl was DELICIOUS and that extra beef was a true mound of beef. The sticky rice paired so well with the beef, kale, and sweet potatoes. I mf love sticky rice. But at the end of the day, that extra $8 was just pain. Pain everywhere.

Sadly, I'm a masochist so I'll 1000% be back. Just no extra beef for me anymore smh.

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov_reviews
reviews.author: Johnny Novo

reviews.text:
So excited to get my hands on THISBOWL's salad! I've been craving for it since their opening, and it's living up to my anticipation.

We got The O.G. and Miso Salmon bowls. The O.G. is a delicious mix of avocado, tobiko, seaweed salad, kale, beets, etc. You can pick salmon sashimi/steamed chicken as the protein, but I switched it to miso salmon and I feel like I've made the right decision. The miso salmon is perfectly tender, living rent free in my head.

The roasted sesame dressing really shines through. I asked for free wasabi mayo on the side. Imo you don't have to drizzle a lot otherwise the spicy tanginess will be too overpowering.

I chose half brown rice and half mixed leaves as the base. The salad bowl was very filling and I could split it into two meals. The portion, generous toppings and quality justify the steep price even though I still found it quite expensive for salad ( ~$18 per bowl).

Funny story: they forgot my miso salmon lol I was shocked to find no protein in my bowl (and it wasn't even peak hour). They gave me back the salmon later but make sure to CHECK your bowl before you leave the store lol.
reviews.author: Ruby Chan

reviews.text: SO GOOD! I loved the sushi rice and especially the eggplant. Love the little crunchies on top. They are so quick too! Definitely more expensive than sweetgreen or other fast casual places but you’re getting high quality food and a lot of it.

My miso salmon bowl was great! The salmon was cooked just right. I don't think I'd ever had not overcooked salmon at any fast casual restaurant before.

reviews.text:
Let me state up front the food is great in the healthy hearty bowl space  - but I’m giving 1 star to flag an issue with the bone broth. It’s not defatted—for non-keto people you’re consuming a MASSIVE amount of saturated fat and cholesterol in every cup (see photos). After sipping the chicken broth and noticing the slight greasy feel on my palate, I took it home to refrigerate overnight as a test. Sure enough, look at the thick layer of grease on top (see photos).
Springbone should invest in a stock dispenser that draws from the bottom (like a watering can) so the fat floating on the top stays separate from the stock. It’s not perfect (as the fat won’t separate as cleanly under heat), but it’s better than this. Or, chill, defat and reheat. I know it’s an extra step, but if you build your brand on bone broth it should be done right.

reviews.text: Visited this restaurant twice already. I was missing Chinese food (especially Shanghai cuisine) too much, given that it’s been eight years since i was home last time. Of course, there remain gaps from the authentic cuisine that you would have back in China, but this is probably the best you can have. This is place is also clean without worrying too much about sanitation or safety issues you may have in restaurants in Flushing. We have tried : shredded lettuce salad, mandarin fish with sweat sour sauce, shredded eel, salted egg pumpkin, and all of them met my expectations.
reviews.author: Ellen Qian

reviews.text:
I had the pleasure of dining here recently, and the experience was fantastic. The food was bursting with authentic flavors, especially the spicy soup, which had the perfect balance of heat and savory goodness. The stir-fried dish with a mix of fresh veggies and tender meat was also cooked to perfection, with every bite packed with rich and satisfying taste. The presentation of the dishes, as seen in the photos, was appealing, making the meal even more enjoyable.

The atmosphere of the restaurant felt cozy and welcoming, complemented by friendly service. Everything, from the attention to detail in the decor to the vibrant food, made this a top-notch dining experience. Whether you’re a fan of bold flavors or more subtle dishes, there’s something here for everyone.

Highly recommend this place for anyone craving delicious Chinese cuisine in a relaxed yet stylish setting!
reviews.author: Esteban Choi

reviews.text: I found this restaurant by searching for nearby eateries. The storefront is small but very exquisite, and the environment is quite nice. However, the lone server seemed a bit overwhelmed. The dishes all tasted good, though the stinky tofu was a bit salty. The fish-flavored shredded pork is highly recommended, my child also really enjoyed this dish. I will definitely come back next time.

reviews.text: Amazing Chinese cuisine. I had chicken soup dumplings, General Tso chicken, wontons and potatoes and everything was very delicious. Food came out fast and the waiter and ambience was delightful. Prices wasn’t bad either! Definitely recommend.

reviews.text:
Looking for good dim sum? You will not disappointed here. It’s not fancy place but their food is good. Porcini beef fried rice is really tasty. Not a lot of beef but the taste is really flavorful. I highly recommend this dish.  Their soup dumplings are delicious. I got both pork and crab soup dumplings. I have to order 2nd order for pork dumplings. My son really likes it. The crab one doesn’t have much crab meat inside but the soup inside tastes good.

Another dish that I ordered but I don’t recommend is the tree one. It’s fancy. Good for picture but the taste was ok. Too little of the shrimp meat inside. Too much of the crunchy outside. It’s kind of plain.

reviews.text: A hidden gem for authentic Vietnamese cuisine! The restaurant has a warm and cozy atmosphere. The staff were incredibly welcoming and attentive. The pho was a amazing. The broth was rich and perfectly balanced. The generous portions of tender, melt in your mouth meat and fresh herbs made each bite a delight. Every detail, from the silky noodles to the fresh lime and basil, was thoughtfully prepared. This is a cash only establishment so don’t come in without it.
reviews.author: Joshua Dyer

reviews.text: Their food is above average, though not overly impressive. I tried the Summer Roll, Saigon Shack Pho, and Grilled Pork Vermicelli. While everything was light, it still retained good flavor. I highly recommend the Grilled Pork—it was perfectly grilled and packed with flavor. Even though the other dishes didn’t wow me, the Grilled Pork stood out and ranks among my top three grilled pork dishes at Vietnamese restaurants.
reviews.author: Popotatoes

reviews.text: Saigon Shack is a great spot for Vietnamese food. Just a heads up: if you're paying cash, you can order from the server; otherwise, you use a QR code to order and pay, which includes a minimum 18% tip even if you're doing most of the work. Despite this, the food is consistently excellent. We had the Shrimp Spring Rolls, Crab Cakes (comes with tartar sauce but I'd recommend asking for more of the salad dressing to brighten it up), Beef Pho, and the Classic Banh Mi sandwich. Perfect lunch spot in the city. Note that they don't take reservations, so you'll need to wait in line and your whole party has to be there to be seated.

reviews.text: After a day of showing my out of state friend around the city and enjoying various foods, we ended at this ramen place near Washington Square Park. We started with soju to kickstart our appetite and tried the karaage chicken, which was pretty basic. Then we ordered the Tan Tan Ramen and Karai Miso Ramen, asking for the spiciest versions. Unfortunately, they weren't spicy at all, and the broth was bland and unflavorful. It was one of the rare times I couldn't finish my meal. I gave it 3 stars because the portions were good despite the quality. I hope the restaurant sees this review and improves the quality of their food.

ChIJqWZKEtBZwokRhMgYIerxVw8.gmaps_name: DH Noodles (Dunhuang 敦煌兰州拉面）

reviews.text: Dining at Dun Huang’s new Greenwich Village location was unforgettable! The staff’s warmth, attentiveness, and knowledge about the menu made the experience truly special. The hand-pulled noodles were a masterpiece, fresh, flavorful, and perfectly textured. Beyond noodles, the crispy popcorn chicken, juicy beef pita burger, and my favorite, the lamb pilaf topped with cucumber salad, were bursting with bold flavors. The tender lamb ribs and sticky rice dessert, with honey, nuts, and red bean filling, added the perfect finish. With incredible food, outstanding service, and a welcoming atmosphere, Dun Huang is a must-visit. I’ll definitely be back for another full flavor experience!
reviews.author: Trishana Jairam

reviews.text:
The hand pulled noodles are clearly fresh made and are cooked to al dente perfection here. The pepper fragrant noodle soup (N7) was an excellent, warming bowl for the colder months ahead: spicy from the chili oil, hearty from the peanut sauce, and fresh from the herbs.

The sweet and sour short ribs were fun to eat, tender, and tasty. The scallion pancake was flaky and chewy as expected.

It’s a spacious restaurant and as of now it’s easy to walk in whether you have a small or large party. The food came out very quickly. I will definitely be back!

reviews.text:
Bagels had great texture, whether toasted or not, and were so fluffy and soft on the inside! Cream cheeses had a more natural taste than most other bagel shops, specifically the mix-ins that go into the cream cheese. For example, one flavor with green onions tasted super fresh, which I liked but others may not.

Sort of a weird ordering process - food at one counter and drinks at the other, but the shop wasn’t too busy when I visited so this shouldn’t be too much of a hassle.
reviews.author: Kunrui Peng

reviews.text: The bagels here are delicious, with the perfect balance of texture—not too soft or too hard. They offer a wide selection of flavors, making you want to return to try them all. The ordering process is straightforward: place your bagel order at the first counter, then head to the back to order drinks and pay. Their matcha latte is particularly good and highly recommended. Just be prepared for a bit of a wait during peak hours, as the place can get quite busy and the line can get long.
reviews.author: Omar Shoman

reviews.text: Well, well, well… how you’ve pleasantly surprised me, Brooklyn Bagel and Coffee Company. I came in with very low expectations, anticipating a typical bagel chain style bagel: flat, flavorless, and underwhelming. To my astonishment, I was treated to a delectable bagel breakfast. I ordered my own custom bagel without any issue, served by helpful and patient staff. While not cheap, it was not ludicrously expensive, a trait that has unfortunately  become increasingly difficult to find in our great city. The wait was minimal, despite the big rush that had come in before me. It operates with an air of professionalism and ran as a well oiled machine. The restaurant was generally clean, air conditioned, and brightly lit, a welcome reprieve from the overbearing New York summer heat. Overall, I would recommend BB&CC to any hungry individuals looking for a chill breakfast/lunch.
reviews.author: ilan :l

reviews.text: Not the everything bagel we ordered, but I do not like sending it back because of waste. The plain bagel also spoke for itself, was awesome and the bacon spread on it was soo crunchy and yummi! Defo recommend. We halved one as the bagels are so big, it was more than enough!

reviews.text: Good bagel, ton of cream cheese as a proper nyc bagel should be accompanied with.  BUT… we came back here today because the bagel we used to get here wasn’t just good, it was unique and EXCELLENT.  Fluffy and chewy was the best way to  describe how it used to taste.  In fact, it was our favorite bagel we had had in our 20+ years nyc.  I asked the manager if there was new ownership and he said no… then asked if the recipe changed and he said yes they change the way they make their bagel.  Not sure if the ingredients are lesser or if they skip vital steps in the process to save $$ considering all the inflation in the economy but in any case, it now tastes like an ordinary good bagel.  Btw…All the awards and mentions also happened to come when they used their former recipe.  NOTE to mgmt: please consider going back to your original recipe before your business begins to decline.

reviews.author: Angie O.

reviews.text:
Great food, coffee, and pastries!

The space is very pretty but it's super cramped. Unfortunately, the wait times can also get pretty long which makes this...
reviews.author: Emily B.

reviews.text:
Mamoun's Falafel is a classic, old-school establishment that consistently draws a crowd—and for good reason. The food is always fresh and delicious, making it a favorite spot for many. There’s never any issue with the quality or taste of the food; it’s simply excellent.

However, there are a few things to keep in mind. First, they only accept cash, so be prepared. If you’re short on cash, you'll need to use the ATM right outside the store, which charges a $3 fee. The staff, while efficient, can sometimes come across as brusque, especially when you request extras like sauce on the side or if you’re a dollar short. Also, seating is very limited, so it's best to plan on taking your food to go. The prices are slightly on the higher side, but given the quality of the food, it's worth it.
reviews.author: Sadat Irtisum

reviews.text: This place is literally a hole in the wall! There's hardly any space to stand inside the store, but the food is exceptional! The food came out pretty fast, and they had some outdoor seating on the street. The sandwiches are a bit messy cause they are stuffed with goodness! Would definitely go back!
reviews.author: Sadia Chowdhury

reviews.text:
I tired this place because it seems iconic and recommended but to be honest it fell a little flat for me. I ordered the lamb pita sandwich to try on my visit. Truthfully it lacked anything to make it feel special and worth the trip besides the fact that it was reasonably priced. The meat was a little chewy, the lettuce tasted like pre-chopped butter lettuce from a Trader Joe’s bag, and the toppings lacked depth.

I wouldn’t recommend this spot given how many other spots you have to choose from in New York.
reviews.author: Peter Farejowicz

reviews.text:
Food: 4/5
Service: 5/5
Atmosphere: 1/5

The falafels were no doubt the star of the show. I got some falafels and the falafel sandwich. I found the sandwich to be tangy and sour.  I’ve had better sandwiches. The falafels themselves on their own were quite good! Service was fast. It is a hole in the wall with 2 tables with 2 seats inside the place. They have a makeshift seating outside which is really in bad shape. I wanted to enjoy my meal here but the seating made it difficult to do so. I know it’s New York City, and space is not plentiful. Next time, I’ll try the chicken shawarma.
reviews.author: Sabah D.

reviews.text: We came here on a food tour and it did not disappoint! I love a good restaurant with a good back story and even better food! The falafel was flavored to perfection! Will definitely be back

reviews.text: Went on a Thursday but couldn’t find him, not sure if he is still here, will try again tomorrow earlier. Went again on a Tuesday early and he was there ! Great NY spot, he takes care of ever single customer and you can the passion for each dish he cooks. I ordered the Pondichery and Samosa, fresh and great dishes to try on the go. reviews.text:
Fantastic Dosas in NYC! The chef has become quite renowned, and his food truly lives up to the hype. He's also incredibly kind-hearted. Despite the long line, he made sure our child was served first, without having to wait. Service like this is a rare find these days.
Of course this isn’t like a real South Indian dosa but eat on the go it is perfectly fine.
reviews.author: Anand Chap

reviews.text: Amazing samosas and Masala dosa! I am not a dosa person, but this one sold me with the vegetable soup on the side for dipping. I loved the samosas with the green coconut chutney- it was the best samosas I ever had! Friendly & personable service as well where you can tell the guy cares about what he does. For a Monday, the wait was long as there was a long line but it’s worth it! We ate our food on park benches nearby which was nice.
reviews.author: Jaimie Varughese

reviews.text:
We went on our first day in NYC which was Friday. For lunch, we sought out NY Dosas since we badly wanted some good, authentic Indian grub. There was a line when we got there and it was 94 deg F that day. Was it worth the wait of over 30 minutes? Heck yeah! The dosa was amazing and the samosas were tasty. We got both at spicy level. They also came with sauces. The dosa came with coconut chutney - amazing! We paid $18 for the dosa, two samosas and two bottles of water. Definitely a good value for your money for NYC. We learned they’re taking some time off and won’t be back until Tuesday so I’m glad we went today.

The owner was extremely friendly and engaging. I can totally see why he is famous. I’d be a regular if I lived in the area.
reviews.author: Ella Pichette

reviews.text: Ny Dosa is a good spot to try dosas. As an Indian, I didn’t find the taste much different, but I’m sure foreigners will enjoy it. The service is great—the owner speaks multiple languages and keeps customers engaged with his conversation. However, be prepared for long lines and a bit of a wait.

If I could give 10 stars I would! The food was beyond delicious. We had the tuna crispy rice, tuna tarts, short rib gyoza, wagyu skirt steak, spicy crispy shrimp, the red snapper tacos, the avocado crispy rice, the toro tartare, the yellowtail sashimi and the chocolate cake for dessert.

The tuna tarts, short rib gyoza and the red snapper tacos were absolutely delicious and might be my favorite bites in NYC.

Just be aware that is pretty costly, but 100% worth the big bill.

Wow!! Gustavo, Natalio, and Carlos stole the show with their unparalleled hospitality! Their warm attentiveness, extensive menu knowledge, and genuine care for guests made our dining experience truly unforgettable.

While the cuisine was outstanding, it was the service that left us eager to return. Gustavo, Natalio, and Carlos's dedication to excellence and personalized attention created a welcoming atmosphere that felt like home.

We'll be back – not just for the exquisite food, but for the exceptional service. They're the heart of Bond St, and we can't wait to experience their warmth again.

Thank you so much!

reviews.text: One of the best sushi I've EVER had!!! Cute little place, they make the food right in front of you, everything is super fresh and tasty. We visited twice, and both times there was no crowd. Friendly and helpful staff, amazing flavors, and such reasonable prices!!! A must-visit!

reviews.text: THIS IS THE BEST TAKEOUT IN NYC!!!!! This tastes like 5 start omakase to go. Their sushi is so fresh, their staff is so nice when you eat inside, and their sushi counter is small and super intimate. I’m OBSESSED with their sushi premium box which comes with the best toro roll ever and all the best pieces of nigiri. Their ikura is outstanding, i live for their uni, and all of there toro is TO DIE!!! I also love their 3 roll box combo. their best roll is spicy scallop. ORDER ASAP🫶🏼🍣🤭🥹♥️✨

reviews.text: This high-quality takeout omakase is a standout choice for sushi aficionados. The buttery tuna melts in your mouth, delivering rich, savory flavors. The o-toro and chu-toro are particularly amazing, with their luxurious textures and deep, satisfying taste. The sea urchin is equally exquisite, with a fresh, creamy texture that exemplifies top-tier seafood. Each piece is expertly crafted, ensuring a gourmet dining experience right at home. For those seeking premium sushi takeout, this omakase is an exceptional option.
reviews.author: Doreen Ng

reviews.text:
🍣 Sushi 295 Mercer: A Hidden Gem in Greenwich village 🍣
Nestled cleverly at the name address, Sushi 295 Mercer is a delightful surprise. It’s not easy to spot from the outside, especially for fast walkers. Once you step inside, you see a counter with just 4 chairs, but believe me - you’re in for a treat. Here’s why Sushi 295 Mercer stands out:
Quality Fish: The owner focus is on top-notch fish. For just $23, you get a generous lunch meal of twelve sashimi, along with sushi rice on the side. The fish practically melts in your mouth, with exquisite flavors. I loved the sushi rice (not many places pay particular attention to it) – it was just the right texture, temperature, and the delicate taste – bravo!
Authentic Experience: The ambiance is cozy, not vested much in interior design – but in the food. It feels local, fits well into the neighborhood, and the friendly staff adds to the warm atmosphere.
Omakase Option: If you feel adventurous, they also have 12 pieces sushi omakase.
I went for Sushi & Sashimi dinner set of 6 nigiri and 9 sashimi accompanied by a toro roll (some extra). Still remember the taste of each piece, from yellowtail to salmon to scallop to tuna to toro. Exquisite!
Trust me, it is worth exploring. Whether you’re dining solo or grabbing takeout, whether you’re after exquisite sashimi or grabbing a spicy roll, Sushi 295 Mercer delivers quality sushi.
Expect lines at times —word has spreading about this hidden gem!
Excellent value for your money.
Highly recommend.
reviews.author: Arie Rozichner

reviews.text:
If you're looking for a no-frills, classic New York City hot dog experience, Papaya Dog is the place to go. I recently stopped by, and while it's not a fancy joint, it definitely delivers on what it's known for: quick, affordable, and satisfying fast food.

The hot dogs were tasty—just the right amount of snap when you bite into them—and I appreciated the fresh, simple toppings. The fries were crispy and hot, and paired perfectly with their signature papaya drink, which adds a unique twist to the meal.

The service was efficient, and though the place is a bit cramped and bustling, it’s part of the NYC charm. It’s not a spot where you’d sit down for a long meal, but for a quick, delicious snack, it hits the mark.

If you’re in the mood for an authentic, fast-food hot dog experience while in NYC, Papaya Dog is a solid option
reviews.author: Emily Maguire

reviews.text: Nothing, and I mean nothing, is more New York than stepping into Papaya Dog and just having a quick bite for those traveling around. These days, getting quick meals and friendly service seems like an impossible task in this economy. Not so with these guys. Yes, there are plenty of fine dining establishments in NYC. But give me a dog and juice anytime!

Then the hot dogs are the skinniest hot dogs I have ever seen and my drink was half foam. So two super skinny hot dogs and half of a papaya drink for $10 is a poor value for my money.

reviews.text: When did the Alley get replaced?! Luckily, the restroom was not replaced, so I was able to use it after ordering. It was very clean and spacious. It did feel a bit awkward that I was the only customer on a beautiful Saturday evening. The decor is pretty, and there were many open seats for relaxing. I decided to get the Hawthorne drink and wagyu black truffle buns. For 4 buns to be only $9 seemed like a steal, but I should have lowered my expectations. Although the name was fancy, it wasn't good. It seemed like the filling was the usual pork and a hint of truffle oil. Combined with thick dough skin and virtually no soup juice, I didn't enjoy it. Perhaps I should have just stuck to original traditional flavors. The staff also didn't inform me that the buns took a while to make it, so I was waiting for a while for them. My drink was mediocre as well. The bits of Hawthorne at the bottom were outputting and impossible to suck through the straw provided. I hope Gold Bao incorporates hot drinks in the future!

reviews.text: It was my first time trying bao and it was amazing! I got the kimchi pork and it was so tasty!
reviews.author: Sarah E.

reviews.text: This was surprisingly a good place! I was surprised by the noodles. They were delicious! I will say I’m giving it 4 stars because the pricing is high. Given the area, I understand why. The service was good as the server was very attentive and friendly and the noodles are what stood out the most to me. The egg rolls were just okay, the oysters were decent and the tres leches were also good but slightly dry. Nice place to come with a friend or group of friends as there is plenty of seating or even alone to sit at the bar.
reviews.author: Jason

reviews.text: I came to a Salsa party here. What a great surprise to have Cuba libres with Havana Club. The guac is amazing and the bartender is friendly!
reviews.author: Luis Salgado-Clara

reviews.text: Heard great things about this place from restaurant week so had to try this Cuban Asian fusion. The downtown location was cute with a front porch in nice weather. Great ambiance with old school vibe. We made it for happy hour and got wine and sangria. Sangria was too sweet in my opinion. For food we got Cuban egg rolls which were stuffed and came with a good sauce. Next was mushroom wontons also great flavor. Dishes were salmon, chicken and rice, and tops vieja noodles.  Meat was tender and juicy served in a rich broth with thick noodles. Yummy and filling. Overall, I was expecting a more from the hype and popularity but still a good experience.
reviews.author: Amanda Libero

reviews.text: Cute restaurant in the heart of West Village. Very nice space outdoors. We ordered appetizers that were delicious, the Cuban sandwich spring rolls were out of this world and the tostones rellenos were also very good. As main dish we ordered fried rice and the mushroom noodles. Both were very good. The only reason why I'm not giving the food a 5 is because I find it overpriced for what it is. $28 for a fried rice seems too much. The appetizers were reasonable.
reviews.author: Cecilia Ponte

reviews.text:
Went here for restaurant week & it was fantastic! The steamed shrimp wontons & spring rolls to start were delicious! The dirty rice and lobster noodles were also incredible!  And lastly the lava cake & tres leches cake were wonderful.
The service was also incredible. I've never received my drinks so fast. The staff were very attentive and incredibly helpful. Will definitely be going back!

reviews.text:
First time at JWF. Make a reservation.

Brand new location. Clean, reservation was speedy, and professional staff.

Excellent breakfast and brunch choices - tried the spaghetti and chicken meatballs. Delicious with their own custom spaghetti. Their lattes are good $6. Bottomless coffee $5.

Would come again.
reviews.author: Albert K

reviews.text: This is my second JWF in NYC and I am in love with their concept. The space is wonderful and the service was nice. However, I didn’t have the same excitement as on the first visit and also I think the food was tastier at the JWF Chelsea branch.
reviews.author: David Chitanava

reviews.text:
Everyone I've brought here has asked to go again.

Their yogurt is the best I've ever had. I've brought 2 people here and forced them to try it. Both wanted to order it again the next week! The Mediterranean breakfast is also great.

The inside is loud but the outside seating is calm especially in the morning. They're dog-friendly. Lots of vegetarian options. The cocktails are well crafted. The service is fast and attentive without rushing you.

My only nits: the bottomless drip coffee is watery. I wish they had a stronger/nuttier blend. The rosewater waffle is just a waffle. There's no special waffle taste or anything. I suppose I expected it to be more like a gourmet waffle (crispy on the outside, thick/fluffy inside, with hints of vanilla and another subtle flavor).

Those are just nits though.
reviews.author: Amelia Warren

reviews.text: Having been to two other locations, they’re all pretty much the same.  The appetizers are good but everything else is pretty mediocre.  The apps are same for all meals so would just stick to that and drinks. We got zucchini chips, cauliflower and eggplant for apps. I tried to green shakashuka which wasn’t very flavorful and came out cold. We also tried the steak sandwich and the meat was a bit too tough and dry for my liking.
reviews.author: Sandy Tseng

reviews.text: Similar to other recent reviews, I thought this location was pretty good. The food is just as it always is at their other locations, same menu and generally the same level of quality and quantity. The ambience is different from their main location as it is less lively/busy. That’s a plus since it was not hard to grab a table at all. Service is quick and the staff were super kind and friendly. Biggest qualm for me was that there were a ton of flies indoors. Overall, not bad.

reviews.author: Evan N.

reviews.text:
One of my favorite bars in NYC. Quiet, cozy, great cocktail and fresh seafood every time. However, worth all the cons..?! Not sure 🤔

Pro:
- quiet & cozy
- great craft cocktails with fun presentations, all tiki themed
- all the items on the menu were fresh (ugh, the uni😍) and full of flavors
- none of the menu items disappointed me (the caviar 😭)
- tropical interior on point

Con:
- every time I visit, it is more difficult to get a reservation. They always seem to be booked for a private party
- every item on the menu is expensive
- if you’re a party of 3 or more, the place will be very crowded and uncomfortable as the place is extremely small.
- menu is limited. I really go for the uni toast and the cocktails
reviews.author: Gloria (glo_trotter)

reviews.text: Very loud especially how small it is. It is a very lovely cocktail bar which I enjoyed but surprised it was Michelin star rated, since it really is a high end cocktail bar rather than a restaurant.
reviews.author: Meghan Schott

reviews.text:
I love ZZ's Clam Bar, a very tiny, very wonderful bar and rawbar / seafood place.  Reservations are absolutely required, and the place is a total splurge.  It  functions like a speakeasy, and seats something like 12-16 people at tiny marble tables.  It's a bit like a jewel box, and it feels like something out of a  different era, underscored by their vintage barware collection.

They have amazing, super crafted cocktails - some of the best - and incredible, fresh seafood.  The Chianina beef carpaccio with sea urchin and caviar is absolutely and completely over the top and something I dream about.
reviews.author: Jennifer Duarte

reviews.text: Get in there if you can book a table! What a gem! They have 4-5 tables and the menu is raw but every bit amazing! The trout roe toast tastes like a divine dish created to make people happy:):)
reviews.author: Sam D

reviews.text:
Disappointed.  We at at ZZ’s Friday, 10/1 (only learned it was reopening night from this post), and it was probably our worst dining experience in all of our years in NYC.  To say that the menu was limited is a gross exaggeration; it consisted of toast (tuna, trout roe or uni), oysters and caviar.  The service was unfriendly and slow.  The drinks were too strong.  The oysters were nice but the Orient Pearls did not seem fresh.
A “reopening” this poorly done should have been postponed (perhaps indefinitely).

reviews.text: I have been trying to get a refund for a cancelled order (cancelled because after an hour and a half I hadn't received it) for over two months!! I spoke with the store 5+ times and each time they said they'd refund it but didn't. I filed a complaint with Domino's but all it did was prompt the store to call me and lie to me about putting a refund through. This has been such a waste of my time and emotional energy. They are awful. I recommend you not order from them.
